Reviews.Title: “Great value and even better hosts”
Reviews.Author: David F
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Welrome April 3-6. The hotel is a very good value for the level of service that you get. The hosts MAry and Carlo are the perfect peolple to help direct you around the city. They will point you in the right direction based on how long your stay. They are particularly good at giving local tricks to avoid lines and get as nice of a meal as you want for your particular budget. Each of their recommended local restaurants knew them and provided above ordinary service. The rooms are very clean and quiet for being in a major city. If you are going to Rome and want to see the city and are not worried about staying in a luxury property you could not do any better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - owners passionate about their city”
Reviews.Author: filthyrichfil
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located close to the Railway Station and with a shopping center nearby and plenty of places to eat nearby. The rooms were spacious and comfortable with good bathrooms. Probably the best part about our stay there was how helpful and passionate about their city the owners Carlo and Mary were. Both were so willing to help you plan your days outings and spoke about the places they recommended with great passion and often referred us to articles in books they had in reception area. Next time we are in Rome we would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Teo L
Reviews.Content: Our recent 6 nights stay - 23 Dec to 29 Dec - at Welrome was great! Mary & Carlos are a delightful couple with a wealth of information about the history of Rome, the sights and places to visit and even where to have delicious yet affordable Italian food! Their keen desire to share their knowledge made our visits to the historic areas interesting and enjoyable! Will stay here again if we return to Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - fantastic owners”
Reviews.Author: Larissa B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2011. On check in Mary was so incredibly helpful with her advice - she even worked out an intinerary for us based on what we wanted to see, and how much time we had, to maximise out time! We also took her advice on where to go for dinner one night and had an amazing meal. This hotel is not luxurious but has everything you need if you're not planning on spending a great amount of time in your room. Both Mary and Carlo were great in helping us use the free wi-fi which we struggled with. On the morning of our departure we had to leave at 4.30am and when we opened the door Mary was waiting to escort us to the lift and assist with our bags - just fantastic. Can't fault the Welrome for it's value for money and the service provided by Mary and Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, terrific owners!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaAk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Welrome for 6 nights October 24 - 30. The walking directions from the train station were simple and we found the hotel easily - even after traveling for 24 hours to get there. On our arrival, the owner, Mary, was very helpful and showed us to our room, gave us a map and routed out an afternoon city walking tour. It was perfect and we had a wonderful first afternoon. The next morning, we had accidentally set our clocks wrong (pm instead of am) and overslept and missed our morning tour. Mary called the tour company for us and got them to let us take the tour the next day. She was an immense help to us throughout our stay. Helping us find grocery stores, restaurants, making reservations for us, telling us which bus to take. You couldn't ask for a better hostess. Be prepared - the rooms are small, as were all the hotel roooms we stayed in on our 3 1/2 week Italy trip. Rooms in Italy are nothing like you find in the US, but it is all part of the charm and experience of being in a foreign country, right? The location is very good. Plenty of things are close, including a church around he corner that we just happened to wander into our first day - it turned out to be built by Michelangelo from the old Roman baths and had the most enormous pipe organ i have ever seen! It's close to the Roma Termini (main train station) where you can get the subway to the coloseum and other areas). And the buses all stop just around the corner from the hotel. Mary helped us become experts at public transportation. Heed all the warnings about pickpockets. I did have someone try to take things from my purse while we were on the subway packed in like sardines! And I'm fairly certain it was a woman with a baby in a baby carriage. She used the baby as a distraction while she reached into your bag. When I got off the subway train, all the zippers on my purse were open. Luckily she didn't find anything of value to take as I had my money and credit cards in my pocket. Mary was such a wonderful hostess and a huge help to us through our whole stay so I would stay there again if we get back to Rome. We could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: 40Sally
Reviews.Content: My two teenagers, my husband, and I stayed at the Welrome for 4 nights in July, 2011. Mary and Carlos are incredible hosts, with a vast knowlege of the History of Rome and ample information on all that there is to enjoy in the city. The rooms are spotless, dark, quiet and air-conditioned, and had a good sized private bathroom. We walked all the way to the Vatican, but if walking is not your thing, the bus access is excellent, and cab fares are very reasonable to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall”
Reviews.Author: Janez K
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 1 week. It was like already written not that centrally placed but still it had a good "overall package"

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and affordable hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Di_Sydney_2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. It's affordable, welcoming, super-clean, comfortable, centrally located and all of the rooms have private bathrooms. It's not swish, but it's impeccably neat and feels like home very quickly. The best thing about the hotel is how friendly and welcoming Mary and Carlo are. Thanks for your wonderful hospitality! And thank you for your local restaurant suggestions- I'm really glad we listened to your recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Mary's Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tony m
Reviews.Content: A ten minute walk from Rome Termini. Easy to find. Not centrally placed but although the pavements are hard, the route into the city centre is pretty direct and,really, tourist Rome isn't too demanding a trek. Some quite descent eating places and a managable supermarket nearby but it's definitely not in the swishest locality. Anyway, Mary and her husband couldn't be more helpful and polite and will draw all over your map to show you the way to all the classic sights. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. Plenty of hot water. The Colloseo has a double and single bed and a little balcony for fresh air. There's a fridge, kettle and tea and coffee. There's not much surface to spread out toiletries or cosmetics. We went as a party of four enjoying a cultural foray but I'm not sure it would be the place for a romantic weekend on a first date to impress.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and fantastic postion in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MICHIA06
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, and comfortable, with beautiful hosts in a excellent loction. I definatly would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MEGAN R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Welrome Hotel and was so grateful for the wonderful information provided by Mary and Carlo who are fantastic hosts. The room was clean and comfortable and very affordable. When I return to Rome I will be booking this hotel and will not even look at any others. Was brilliant and the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Trudy0279
Reviews.Content: Just a short walk to Termini and very convenient to most of Rome's usual tourist destinations. The service was wonderful, I don't think Mary slept once when we were there. Room was large and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean rooms, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Fishers-rock
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights. It was well situated very close to Termini station (5 minute walk) and easy access to classic Rome sights. There are other hotels closer to these sights, but if you are happy with a 10 minute walk, this hotel will work well. The owners are very helpful and will organize reservations at the Borghese for you if you ask (plan to book 2-3 days in advance - also book online for the Vatican to save yourself 2 hours standing in line!). We stayed in the "Colosseo" room which was nice and quiet (window opens up to inner courtyard of sorts). A/C worked well and bathroom was clean. Rooms were clean and tidy, but not that large. All in all, excellent value for money in Rome. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “incredible hosts”
Reviews.Author: SylvainC588
Reviews.Content: Room is functional, Mary and Carlos are incredible hosts: follow their advices for the visit and where to go. The small hotel (7 rooms) is well located and a lot of places can be reach by foot. Mary will sent you some good advices when you confirm the reservation. I would return there anytime !

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming hosts”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller5039
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Welrome Hotel for 6 nights in May 2011. Mary & Carlos were wonderful hosts, always geeting us with a smile at any time of the day or night and happy to share their vast knowledge of Rome. They also supplied complimentary croissants & juice each morning. The rooms are very compact but we had room for our cases. We had a very comfortable queen size bed, a wardrobe, small table & chairs & a small refrigerator & a kettle. The bathroom was fine but the shower was fairly small. All rooms are on the first floor, ours faced the street and was above a restaurant so there was a fair bit of noise that drifted up from there. There is also a larger hotel across the road. However, there were shutters on the windows which blocked out a fair bit of the noise. There is a supermarket & some good inexpensive restaurants nearby. The hotel is easy to find and in a good location if you are arriving & leaving by train. It's also close to the Metro but if you don't mind a good walk you can walk to many of the tourist areas from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Lisa R
Reviews.Content: The owners of the hotel will do anything for you and have a huge amount of knowledge about the city. The hotel is ideally located with the main train station less then a five minute walk away which also has bus connections. The hotel is very clean and secure with all rooms on the first floor. Me and my friend stayed in the patheon room which may be a bit noisy as the hotel across the road can be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “incredible hosts”
Reviews.Author: julia b
Reviews.Content: The hosts/owners of this hotel take incredible pride in the hotel and are passionate about helping you have a wonderful experience in Rome. They are very helpful with getting around the city and sites to see. Fresh croissants await you outside your room for breakfast. Your room has a small fridge so you can keep a few juices, etc. The room was clean and reasonably sized. Again, the hosts are truly wonderful and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Functional, good location, great hosts”
Reviews.Author: WillN55
Reviews.Content: This 2 star hotel is run by Carlo and Mary, who are both great hosts and incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about their home city. We used most of their info, and it really is valuable. Rooms are compact (as many are in Europe) and neat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: alicex84
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here during our trip to Italy last summer, and Welrome really gave us a wonderful experience. The rooms were very nice and clean and a great location for the price. What really set apart Welrome though was the service. Mary and Carlos are incredibly welcoming hosts and were always willing and eager to help us make the most of our time in Rome. They suggested out great destinations that we might not have seen otherwise, and they helped us plan and navigate around what for us was a new city. The two of them are incredibly warm, hard-working, and generous people who love their city and love to share their city with visitors, and they helped to make our stay there feel like a second home.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay in this great little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: shepthedog
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a big chain type hotel then look elsewhere. If you are looking for a cosy, friendly family-run small hotel then read on... Found this hotel on TripAdvisor and very glad we did. We were visiting Rome for our 20th wedding anniversary and wanted the perfect trip, Mary and Carlos helped make that possible. The warmth and friendliness is evident from booking, continued on arrival right until the moment of departure. When we checked in Mary gave us two maps and spent probably 20 minutes or so explaining routes and places of interest. I had already drafted an itinerary for our trip but the hints from Mary were invaluable (especially the route to take to the Spanish Steps so you end up at the top and can walk down, rather than the other way round!). Our room was at the front of the hotel overlooking the road which was not a problem in the slightest due to the incredibly effective shutters and windows. When going to bed the room was in total darkness and hardly a noise could be heard. The hotel was full but at no time did we hear other guests moving around in their rooms. While I agree with an earlier review that the TV was small I cannot comment on the picture quality or the channels available as we did not use it at all. Very efficient fridge in the room and small safe which was large enough for cash and passports etc. I had no qualms about leaving my Ipad and camera in the room. There are only 7 rooms in total and had total trust in Mary and Carlos. The hotel provides free wi-fi and you will get the code at check-in. Mary gave me two codes for the two wi-fi services available to ensure I got the best signal. The signal was immediately picked up and was consistently strong throughout our visit. The room (Pantheon Room) was adequate in size, with a comfortable double bed and a small table and two chairs. The bathroom was a good size with good shower pressure. On leaving the hotel the room key is given in at reception (you take the safe key with you) and you have to ring the buzzer to get back to the hotel. This enhanced the hotel security and if we knew we were going to be back especially late we just let Mary and Carlos know. At no time in Rome did we ever feel unsafe walking around, even returning to the hotel at midnight. We pre-booked a car to and from the airport but Termini station is under 10 minutes walk away. Everything was within easy walking distance from the hotel. The only time we used public transport was to get to the Vatican as we had a tour booked at a set time. The nearby metro took 15 minutes to get there. There is a good supermarket near to the hotel and a street market in the next street. There are many restaurants in the area or further afield. If you have not visited Rome before and want to judge distances, it took us 45 minutes to walk from Castel Sant'Angelo back to the hotel, so it would have been about an hour direct walk to the Vatican. We can highly recommend this hotel and will be sure to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with amazing owners!”
Reviews.Author: Tinag33
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Welrome hotel and I can't commend Mary and Carlo more for their amazing hospitality and service. We had a quadruple room which was huge! Big enough to accommodate four adults and all of our luggage comfortably and with a big bathroom. Mary and Carlo are also so helpful with directions and any tips, info etc you need while staying in Rome. The hotel is also about a 5 minute walk from Termini train station where you can catch the Metro and buses easily. I highly recommend this hotel!!!! Thank you Mary and Carlo for an amazing stay!

Reviews.Title: “We had a pleasant stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Canada_TimeTraveller
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel is about 5 minutes walk from Rome Termini. It’s actually situated in between Termini and Repubblica stations. The neighbourhood wasn’t as bad as those very close to Termini station. They don’t serve full-breakfast but each guest is given 1 home-made croissant and juice (which for me is already considered breakfast) every morning around 6:30AM. These are put in a basket with the guest name, and are left on a table on the hallway where guests can take and eat it inside the room. The room comes with air-conditioner, a small safe (vault), personal fridge with complimentary soda. There is a small TV but the channels are all in Italian. Towels are changed daily. There is no elevator. I have requested a room not facing the street so we had really good sleep for 5 nights. The owners Carlo & Mary are very accommodating and friendly. They told us a lot of information on how to take the subway & buses (even the bus route & number), attractions, shopping areas, good restaurants, etc. They know the city very well! Every night when we arrive back to the hotel, they would ask us how our day went, what attractions we’ve seen, and even suggested what attractions we need to see next time and what time of the day it’s best to see it! One time, we told the couple that we’re going to Florence very early the next day so they won’t have to prepare anymore the croissants and juice at 6:30AM. To our surprise, as we headed out of the hotel at 5:45AM the next day, they handed us our small breakfast which they prepared so early so we can eat them on our long trip. What an awesome gesture! I`m pretty sure that other hotels wouldn`t care if we get to eat breakfast or not. My friend and I are first-time Rome visitors, and with the couples’ warm accommodation and great assistance, our visit to Rome has been a pleasurable one.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned, great base camp”
Reviews.Author: Dodger52
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely well positioned being "close" to all the must see bits of Rome and a only a short walk from Termini station. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Room was smallish but OK. Even though it is not a B&B a good starter pack of juices and buns is provided each morning which is more than adequate to get you on your way.

Reviews.Title: “What the Welrome has that other hotels don't.......Mary and Carlo!”
Reviews.Author: kitkat1973
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the good reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The rooms are small (not a problem, we were out all day!) but they are clean, the shower was excellent, pillows and bed comfy and it was nice to have tea/coffee making facilities in our room (a notable absence in other hotels we stayed in). Croissants and juice in the morning were adequate breakfast for us. Free wifi was well-used by us. Mary and Carlo were easily the friendliest and most helpful hosts we had during our 5 weeks travelling around Italy. Because of delays with our flight to Rome we arrived much later than expected, at 11.30pm! Yet Carlo was ready and waiting for us and greeted us with a big friendly smile. We couldn't have asked for a warmer welcome. Mary and Carlo do everything possible to help you enjoy your stay in Rome - nothing is too much trouble and they have extensive knowledge of their city, places to visit etc. We stayed there for 5 nights (the bigger Colosseo room - quiet) at the beginning of our trip and one night at the end (Pantheon room - on street but no noise, good windows/shutters). We took Mary's recommendation for dinner at 'Giovanni's' - nice food at reasonable prices! Cannot recommend the Welrome more highly!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hosts - like staying with a pleasant aunt”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_on_Hols
Reviews.Content: Mary and Carlos were both very friendly and helpful - they love Rome and want you to also. Lots of good tips, starting with the email you get on confirmation of your booking (eg telling you how to book for the Vatican Museum etc). The hotel is near the train station so handy for arrival/departure and also for the Metro as both lines cross at the Termini. As others have noted the hotel does provide pastries and juice to start your day (my son loved this - like the Easter bunny every day :)). The rooms also have a small fridge and a kettle and coffee/tea and there is a supermarket close by. There also is good free wifi - just ask Mary and she'll give you the plug in modum. However, this hotel wont be for everyone. It is a bit like staying with someone - the front door is usually locked so the hosts open it for you on a buzzer, the rooms are basic, the towels tiny, the TV small and no English language channels and you can hear other guests moving around. We weren't on the street side so no street noise. The area is handy but not as interesting or glamorous as other parts of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location with wonderful hosts”
Reviews.Author: Nat_che
Reviews.Content: I liked welrome hotel a lot and I believed it is definitely one of the reason that I loved Rome so much! The hosts are both very helpful, especially Maria. She told me a lot of money saving tips which were very useful for a budget traveler like myself. She also offered to call the Borghese Gallery to make reservation for me, so I didn't have to give my credit card number for online reservation. I also loved the restaurant Maria recommended. The location of the hotel is wonderful. It is very close to Termini station and there are also bus stations around. It is very easy to travel to all the attractions in Rome. I had the room at the street side, and it was noisy only one or two nights, and it sounds like a bunch of drunk people walk by. I loved this hotel so much and I felt a little guilty only to give the review several months after. I recommended this hotel to all my friends who plan to visit Rome. The only thing I can think about to complain is they don't have single room...

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: kiwi_traveller3
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay at Welrome. The room was basic but clean & tidy & we couldn't fault the service given by the staff who were extremely helpful with tips & suggestions for our outings. Breakfast was a croissant and a juice box served in your room which worked well because you could either have it in your room or take it with you if you had an early start. Location-wise we found everything very easy to get to either by walking or bus (there is a big bus station near by so easy to find one going to the right location). The centre of Rome was probably a 15-20 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “A good value for Rome but some drawbacks.”
Reviews.Author: kupunakane
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean. One room was roomy, the other quite small (though not unusually so for a modest hotel in a European capital.) Mary and Carlo are wonderful hosts, though it is difficult to have a brief conversation or ask a simple question of either one. Our real complaint was the noise from the hotel across the street, something beyond the control of the Welrome. Nevertheless, the large group of young people congregating on the street until the early morning hours made it difficult to sleep. I would not stay here again unless assured that I had a room away from the street side.

Reviews.Title: “Welrome exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: MelissaCross
Reviews.Content: This small, quiet hotel lives up to its excellent reputation. The quad room was equipped with a kettle and tea, and the bathroom was, in our experience, large by European standards. From the hotel we walked to all the major sights. Mary De Rosa was friendly and helpful in explaining what to see and how to get there. After we'd checked out she contacted us to let us know our son had left his headlight behind, then sent it on to us. Outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value & service”
Reviews.Author: MargaritaUae
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights with our two children (10&12). The room was basic, with fridge and tea/coffee facilities, and it was clean and comfortable. Mary arranged for fresh croissants and juice each morning. The location was great for walking to most of the major attractions. Mary & Carlo were the best hosts out of the whole of our stay in Italy! Their restaurant recommendations were brilliant, Cafe Ciros & Giovanne's. I would highly recommend Welrome to anyone who is looking for value, service & location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Fuzz94
Reviews.Content: The Welrome hotel is only 5 minutes walk from Termini station and in a decent area. we walked everywhere, Trevi fountain was around 15 minutes away, the Spanish Steps around 20 mins, Villa Borghese 20 mins and the colusseum around 30 minutes. The Termini metro stop is very close by. The advice dispensed by the owners was excellent (hidden churces, the best time to visit sights, directions etc) as well as a good supply of maps and guide books. The room was clean and spacious with comfortable bed and air conditioning. The fridge was stocked every day with complementary water and soft drinks and we had fresh crossants every morning. There was a a kettle, fridge and free wifi in the room, all of which were extremely useful. The shower was excellent which is a real bonus in a hotel. Overall I reccommend the Welrome as a good base in Rome, it was better priced than many competitors and on the basis of convenience and comfort very good value.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome stay at the Welrome”
Reviews.Author: 2Roamers61
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 7 days at the Welrome. This 7 bedroom hotel is near the Termini and therefore, metro and trains are within 5 minutes walking distance. However all the major sites aside from the Vatican are within 20-30 mins walking distance. The owners - Mary and Carlos are the perfect hosts. Being Romans, they are very passionate and highly knowledgeable about Rome's tourist attractions. They recommended places to visit which we would not have found in the guidebook. Mary recommended a local restaurant called 'Giovannis' - food was lovely. Carlos made a reservation for us at a lovely restaurant called 'Armando el Pantheon' for my birthday - superb meal. Mary gave me a beautiful silver ornament of St Peter's Basilica and Square as a keepsake from Rome for my birthday. What a beautiful gesture from this lovely couple. I would heartily recommend staying at the Welrome and hope to stay there when we visit the Eternal City in the not too distant future!

Reviews.Title: “A home from home.”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix176160
Reviews.Content: Agree with all other reviews about this hotel. Mary and Carlo cannot do enough for you and their knowledge of all the historical sights as well as local shops and restaurants is exceptional. Your enjoyment of Rome is personal to them and it shows in all they do to make your stay so memorable..

Reviews.Title: “You won't ever regret it”
Reviews.Author: Ada-worcs
Reviews.Content: Welrome Hotel is a very comfortable hotel situated at a walking distance from the Roma Termini ie not more than 10 minutes away and is not very difficult to find. The room was very clean, fresh towels every day, kettle, fridge, hair dryer and safe. For the price it was really excellent. We managed to get to see all the sights we wanted to by foot from the hotel. We took a bus to get to the vatican but that was just to save time and we walked back. The highlight of the hotel is Mary, who greets you warmly on arrival and makes your stay in Rome that much more special. A very kind lady who really wants you to enjoy your stay and gives you endless useful tips. Though the hotel does not provide breakfast she kept a basket of croissants and fruit juice outside our door every morning!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel Well Connected to Mass Transit”
Reviews.Author: wktam67
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for seven nights. The hotel is not fancy but we look at hotels as a place to sleep while we go sightseeing. Our main thing is clean rooms at a reasonable price and Welrome more than met our expectations. Carlo and Mary were always helpful in suggesting places to visit and eat. They pointed out the local supermarket and laundromat around the corner. Carlo has a wealth of information about the sights in Rome and has plenty of practical advice for travelers. While the hotel is not near any of the major tourist spots it is within easy walking distance of the main subway station and a major bus stop making sightseeing a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, perfect location, exceptional service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We made the right choice staying here. It's very near the train station (you'll appreciate this if you're planning to daytrip to Florence) and pickup points for shuttle buses, and the supermarket's around the corner. The hotel is clean, you feel safe and Mary and Carlos make sure that you take the right routes and buses. You almost feel like you don't need a guidebook. They map out all the places to see, how to get there, where to eat, and give you a short history lesson on the art so you'll appreciate it even better! The rooms may be a little small but we felt cleanliness and safety outweighed size, and we enjoyed our stay thoroughly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and fantastic hosts”
Reviews.Author: clementine14
Reviews.Content: Staying at Welrome was a bit like staying with your nan and pop - Mary and Carlos are genuinely caring and interested in ensuring you make the most of your time in Rome. They proposed itineraries, restaurants, tours, and were only too willing to make phonecalls on our behalf to book shuttle buses. When we wanted to post a package home, Mary personally took us to Mr Franco to buy the required brown paper and string; when we tried to leave the hotel in the rain to pick up our laundry, she insisted it be delivered instead by Mr. Hassan - she could not have been more willing to help. Every morning we received fresh croissants and juice at no extra charge, and on our final morning of departure she fixed us a bag of breakfast provisions and lollies for our plane flight. We would recommend this hotel to any first-time visitors to Rome, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great, simple, clean little family hotel - a very pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: Stormy4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Welrome at the end of our Italian experience. Although we had stayed elsewhere in Rome in a better location, the value here was great and the passion of our hosts, Mary & Carlo, for their beloved city cannot be matched. We wanted clean, comfy, simple and easy - and that is what we got. The location is walking distance to the Metro, the Termini and buses and our hosts are full of great tips and advice for touring around the area. We certainly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, very helpful owners.”
Reviews.Author: aussiesinthailand
Reviews.Content: The room at Welrome was small but very clean and had everything we needed. it is in a great location within walking distance to almost every sightseeing location in Rome. Because it is so central, it was a little bit noisy at night, however not enough to put us off staying there again. We had been told breakfast was not available in the hotel however Mary made sure we had croissants and juice outside our door every morning and it is a very short walk to a place that makes great coffee. Mary was a wealth of information on what to see in the city and helped us map out an itinerary for each day including the best places to eat. All her recommendations were spot on and we had a fantastic time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “too small”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Julie
Reviews.Content: Easy to find hotel located 10 mins walk from Termini Station. We booked soley on tripadvisor comments but must say we were let down this time. The location was perfect , we only used public transport once while in Rome , we walked everywhere. Mary , the owner , was very obliging and helpful. The only let down was the size of the room. We didn't have enough room with 2 cases to move around the room without stepping over the cases. The "Trevi"room amenities were fine but just too small. We travelled for 5 weeks through Europe and this was by far the smallest.

Reviews.Title: “As lovely as the breakfast croissants”
Reviews.Author: casleton
Reviews.Content: Welrome hotel is located centrally in Rome - the hosts are lovely - they make sure you get breakfast every day (pastries in a little package for your room) and are very forthcoming with local information. The hotel is small and quiet - the room has all the basics and the price is reasonable for Rome. Mary is very maternal and caring to ensure you have the best stay. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING - definitley recommended”
Reviews.Author: VivCG
Reviews.Content: The basics were thoroughly covered; easy to get to, clean neat room, good proximity to sights... BUT what made Welrome a truly unforgettable and highly recommended hotel is the wonderful advice, assistance and warmth from Mary and Carlo. We will definitely stay with them when in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: PoshinDevon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights and booked the Welrome hotel after reading reviews on this site. All has been said before - it is a great little hotel. Ok its not situated on the Via Venito, but the area is fine and plenty of places to eat out nearby. Plus it is very reasonably priced. We walked all over Rome from the hotel, but the metro is only a 5 minute walk away. Despite this being our 5th trip to the eternal city we still found plenty of places to explore. Plus Mary gave us invaluable advice on places to eat, shop and visit The room was very clean, little fridge for some wine, beer or storing a little food if you wanted to make a snack. Kettle, tea and coffee available as well. Plus an in room safe to store valuables. Recommend this hotel highly - if you want the Via Venito its a short stroll away, otherwise save your money and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like your family!”
Reviews.Author: JodySmith5000
Reviews.Content: Mary & Carlo are wonderful. The location was great - room was nice. Only complaint was the noise from the hotel across the street but if you close the windows you won't hear much. We had so much fun in Rome even though one day poured. Close to everything and Babbo's is great for dinner right across the street. We will stay here again when we come back to Roma!

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard3150
Reviews.Content: Mary is just wonderful and made our stay very special indeed. The hotel is just so small, so central to whatever you wanted and sooooo ideal in Rome. We loved it and would stay there anytime we go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Leonore_Vare
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my boyfriend in this beautiful quiet hotel in august. Clean, spacious room. Hotel itself was modern and the staff very friendly. Specially Mary and Carlo. We spent there wonderful time, also the location is almost perfect. Easy to reach all the important monuments in beautiful city ROME. Thank you friends for such a nice holidays!

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home in the centre of the eternal city of Rome”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLibran
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Welrome Hotel in August 2010 for four nights and then a further 3 nights in September. It is a great little hotel in heart of Rome, close to Termini and easy to find. Mary and Carlo are the best hosts - with information about Rome that you just don't find in the guide books. Comfortable, clean and welcoming, I would recommend this hotel to everyone and anyone who is planning a trip to Rome. With only a few rooms it is just perfect and very reasonable. Will definitely return to Rome and most definitely return to Welrome Hotel. God bless Mary and Carlo

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Welrome”
Reviews.Author: llconnie
Reviews.Content: I had the most wonderful time in Rome and staying at the Welrome Hotel. It was a home away from home. Mary and Carlos who run the hotel were so helpful in mapping out our itineraries for the day. They went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. What can I say about Rome, it is the most lovely city and I plan on returning some day soon and I will be definitely staying at the Welrome again.

Reviews.Title: “11 out of 10!”
Reviews.Author: JandK-Sydney
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is as good as everyone says. Maria & Carlo were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean, quiet and quite spacious for the two of us. It is a very convenient location and great value for Rome. We'd definitely stay here again. Thank you Maria & Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “A quaint,comfortable and safe place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pramila_10
Reviews.Content: "Quaint" is the first word i would use to describe this hotel- an interesting fact is that all the rooms dont have numbers but have names of places to visit in Rome !The rooms are adequately big, are cleaned meticulously everyday, have good bathrooms and bedrooms.The windows can be completely shut to eliminate all noise and the air conditioning is excellent !The area is also very safe and in between Termini and Republica railway stations( both are about a 5-10mnt walk ) When you open the door of the hotel, be it day or night, either Mary or Carlos, are always around (wonder when they get some rest !) offering a warm smile, listening to what you did in the day, offering you advice on the sights that you must see around Rome.. Honestly, had it not been for them ,we would have missed out on some beautiful and not-so-touristy places and some nice eateries as well which have not found their way to the popular guide books ! If you are a first time traveller /or a single woman traveller going to Rome for the first time, or a family, this is the place you need to stay in ..Thank you Mary and Carlos,you made our trip special !!!!- Pramila ,Mumbai -India

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, warm & hospitable hosts, convinient location for sightseeting”
Reviews.Author: Flowerscat
Reviews.Content: The gem of Welrome are Mary and Carlos - they are the perfect hosts for first time visitors to Rome, providing ideas for inteneraries, useful tips about travelling in Rome, advice and information about the best sights and the best places to eat and shop. Using their advice we were able to explore both the hidden and tourist parts of Rome, and found some lovely Italian restaurants to have our long afternoon lunches and rest our feet before starting the second half of the day. Rome is best explored on foot, so while in Rome, do what the Romans do - start off early in the morning when the queues to the attractions are the shortest (organised guided tours usually start around 9:30 am), take a leisurely two hour break between 1-3 when the sun is at its hottest, and start the afternoon again at 3 - in Rome many of the tourist attractions and shops stay open till 8 pm. Be prepared to walk, the hop-on/hop-off bus barely touches the most beautiful sights in Rome, which are only accessible by foot. The hotel is very conveniently located close to the Terminii station (Terravision buses run regularly to Ciampino airport for four euros each way), and is close to bus route 492, which takes you all the way to Piazza Navona and beyond. We would suggest spending your first morning in Rome exploring the area around the hotel on foot, there are a lot of hidden gems around, and it gives you an idea of which bus routes and metro stations are easily accessible. Tickets for the metro or bus can be bought from just opposite the hotel, or at any newstand for one euro for a single ticket, valid for 75 min. Rooms very comfortable and clean, with a tv (the only english channel is bbc news), a small fridge/freezer, and a safe, and air-conditioning which can be adjusted according to your needs. Beds were good, not the most comfortable pillows, but after a day walking around Rome, we were asleep in under 10 mins! The rooms are shuttered and double-glazed, and in spite of being in a room facing the front road, we hardly heard a sound in the room once the windows were shut. Breakfast is not included in the price, but every morning we were provided with a generous croissant and juice, which quiet easily saw us all the way to lunch. A tip for those of you planning to visit the Vatican museum and St. Peters Basilica - we divided the trip into two mornings, as there is a lot to explore. We first visited the Vatican musuems - by booking our entry tickets online, we walked straight in, beating the long queue. On Mary's advice we used the Cipro metro station to access the vatican museum - its a 10 min walk (use Google maps to located outer wall of the Vatican from Cipro, then follow the wall around till you see a long queue ahead). When you come to the Sistine chapel,there is a small corridor then lets you directly access St. Peters, where it is also possible to book a guided tour. The next morning, we spent time exploring the basilica before the tour groups started (this time using the Ottavino metro station - entry to basicilia is free), climbing the cupola & exploring the tombs. We spent both afternoons visiting the lovely fountains of Rome, splitting our day this way allowed to really appreciate the fine art in the Vatican, of which there is a lot to take in. Overall, a very lovely experience, and I would give this hotel an additional star for the charming hospitatlity of the hosts.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific budget hotel with caring and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: DylanBob
Reviews.Content: We spent five days in Rome to see all of the many historical sites and art museums we could fit in. Hotel is small with just 7 rooms. Ours had a small fridge, very effective air conditioner and comfortable bed. Great location as Termini station just a short walk away. Not the best neighborhood but nothing to worry about and an excellent cafe a few steps away serving .90 Euro espresso and cappuccino. Room was very quiet with double pane windows. Mary and Carlos were our hosts. Mary extremely helpful arranging just about anything you need. Big old key to get in and out of your room which you leave with front desk (Mary). She always locks the front door and you have to buzz to gain entry. Room was clean and bath room had a small shower, bidet and nice clean towels. This is a great choice for those looking for clean, basic room for sleeping. Mary also provides a small basket with croissants and juice every morning. There is a kettle for tea and small table with chairs in room. Teeny T.V. For viewing Italian programming and BBC.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and We Walked Almost Everywhere”
Reviews.Author: LeahandTim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a 2 week trip to Italy and Greece and we basically booked all of our hotel accomodations based on Trip Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed with this hotel based on what we were expecting. The room was small but very clean. There was a mini fridge in the room and we bought some stuff one day at the supermarket around the corner so we made use of it. Both Mary and Carlo were very helpful and always available (the reception is open 24/7). They helped give us directions and a map whenever we weren't sure where to go. We walked almost everywhere we went while staying there though by the end of the second day, our feet made us wish we had used the metro more. We did use the metro when we visited the Vatican and it was pretty easy to use. Ask the hotel and they'll help you. Overall, the value of the hotel was great and we were happy that we chose it for our 3 night stay in Rome. Be advised though that when you're in Rome, everyone wants to take advantage of the tourists so they charge you to sit at a table when getting a coffee, eating, a drink, whatever. You should always ask before you order. In some instances it was like 3 euro for a beer but if you sat down it was like 7 euro (and we heard it can be even more expensive, like 15 euro for 2 cappucinos)...We did find one area of Rome that we absolutely loved called Travestere. It is a touristy area but more for Italian tourists. We went there twice in the evening. There were vendors and booths along the Tiber River and lots of little restaurants. It was less expensive and gave us more the feel of the local flavor. We definitely recommend checking it out though it may be a little tricky to get there on your own. If you take a cab, it's like 10 euro each way.

Reviews.Title: “A real jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Bacchus
Reviews.Content: It is hard to say more than has been said on other reviews about this hotel, it really is fantastic. To put it into perspective we followed our four nights at Welrome with stays at 4 star hotels in Sorrento and then Florence, neither of which could match the Welrome for pure value (or free wi-fi or destination advise etc etc). OK so this hotel is not the Ritz and anyone who expects it to be has not understood the reviews on Tripadvisor, it is however a very charming hotel with the nicest and most helpful hosts I have ever met in Carlo and Mary. If you are looking for a comfortable, very clean room with great service in a good location at a reasonable price - then you have just found it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: plainjane626262
Reviews.Content: Great rates, clean, good service. Experienced a wonderful stay and hope to go back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay - great hotel owners”
Reviews.Author: dmah
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on the feedback and were very happy with the stay. The owners (Mary and Carlo) were very friendly and helpful with tips about sightseeing. The hotel is very close to the termini station (very convenient for us). The hotel was within walking distance of many tourist attractions. We were travelling with 2 childrenand the hotel accomodated a quad occupancy. We got free internet service and muffins and juice in the morning. We would recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: barry89
Reviews.Content: Pound for pound, this has to be the best place to stay in the whole of the city. Just 5 minutes from Terminii, most of the main sites are less than 20 minutes stroll. Situated in a quiet street, Welrome is clean and quiet. What makes the Welrome special however, are Mary & Carlo. Nothing is too much trouble for them - and they are so proud of their great city they will glady give you tips and information to make your stay one to remember. Our trip was to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary - Mary & Carlo made a real fuss of us and recommended a great restaurant just around the corner for our celebration supper. If you are going to Rome and want to stay at a top hotel and get excellent value - choose the Welrome Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, great value, bad odor”
Reviews.Author: longhorn_mike
Reviews.Content: The location of Welrome is good in that it's inside the city center, a 5-minute walk from the rail station, and a 5-minute walk to both of the city's metro (subway) lines. I had concerns because I read in a review for another hotel that the area near Termini was seedy, but that must be on a different side of the station from where Welrome is. I found the area around Welrome to be fine. The reason I don't give a higher score for location is because it's about a 20-minute walk to any of the major sites in Rome. Unfortunately the city's 2 metro lines won't get you everywhere; for example, the Pantheon is a 15-minute walk from the nearest station. I was traveling with my wife and her mother, and I think they would have preferred to stay somewhere that would allow us to more easily access the major sites on foot. We ended up taking taxis back to Welrome most of the time. We stayed in the Navona room, which was small but acceptable, typical for Europe. The shower, however, was tiny. I had a difficult time moving inside of it and I'm only 5'10", 160 lbs. Wifi is included in the rate, but the signal strength was weak in our room. The lobby had a much stronger signal. Welrome does not claim to serve breakfast, but tea and instant coffee is provided in the room, and croissants and juice are served each morning. That kept us going until lunch each day. The room had a mini-fridge which was occasionally filled with water and juice throughout our 4-night stay. Sleep quality was pretty good. The windows have interior doors that close over them from the inside, which allowed us to make the room very dark even when the sun was out. There is a restaurant below the hotel that stayed noisy until about 11pm, so be aware of that if you are hoping to get to sleep early. Otherwise the hotel was pretty quiet. The hotel was generally clean, but I gave an average rating on cleanliness because the lobby had a bad odor which permeated up the the hall outside of the rooms. I'm not sure what it was, but it seemed to be there at all times of day, and sometimes made it unbearable to be in the lobby. The staff was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. They had great recommendations for how to get to the important sites. Thanks to their suggestions, we ended up visiting the Galleria Borghese without a reservation. They were (sometimes overly) eager to make sure that we made the most out of our time in Rome. I recommend Welrome for the value, although it may be worth looking into staying a little closer to the main sites if that's possible at a rate comparable to what Welrome charges. Hopefully the problem with the odor will be addressed as well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome ane the Welrome”
Reviews.Author: SuzMelbourne
Reviews.Content: First time for us visiting Rome so we were looking forward to staying at the Welrome. Our daughter and her husband stayed there two years ago after reading the reviews and loved it. We knew that the Welrome would be perfect for us as it was very close to Termini and a lovely walk to most sites in Rome. We took the train to the Vatican and then just spent the rest of that day walking back through beautiful areas of the city. There is so much to see so we allowed 7 nights in Rome and really enjoyed ourselves. We never felt unsafe vene when returning quite late. We found Mary and Carlo to be lovely people who helped enrich our visit both with their help and advice. I had to go to hospital the night that I arrived and their assistance then and in the following days was so very much appreciated. We walked everywhere when we were there and everything was just so close for us. What a beautiful city to live in and thank you personally Mary and Carlo for adding to our Rome experience.We will have memories to last a life time but if we are lucky enough to return to Rome...the Welrome would be our first choice of where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel,great location, warm and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SandKJakarta
Reviews.Content: We really like this hotel and would definitely recommend it to others. It is next to the Termini train station and so you can get around easily. Mary and Carlo are fantastic hosts and will go out of therir way to make your stay in Rome as enjoyable and productive as is possible. Carlo is very knowledgeable when it comes to the many museums and galleries and can give you invaluable advice before you set off on your excursions. The croissant and juice in the morning supplied by the hotel is a nice touch. There are plenty of good value restaurants around the area and Bobbos?? (100m away) has the best Tiramasu that I have ever tasted!!! This is a little gem of a hotel and that is no mean feat when your hotel is in Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Its about more than just the hotel”
Reviews.Author: bilk2005
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend at the Welrome, I chose it due to the positive reviews that others had left and the reasonable cost for what was meant to be a low cost break. However as we have had such a positive experience I have been moved to write my first review. As background I stay in hotels a lot with work, in fact 4 days before my trip I was at the Fairmont in St Andrews comfortably ensconced in a suite so I am use to both ends of the hotel spectrum (the ones work pays for and the ones I spend my own cash on). I should also add that as I work with people all day when I am on holiday I don’t like to mix, in fact the only thing I was not looking forward to at the Welrome was the briefings from Mary and Carlos that so many of the reviewers have talked about. Which is ironic as it was these sessions of advice that made our break great instead of good. Yes, it is true they do spend time talking you through the area and Rome and giving advice on where to go and what to see, Carlos especially will point out little hidden gems once you tell him where you’re going. But to all those who don’t want to listen to this you have and option, simply do as I was going to do and excuse yourself. However I would strongly advise you not to, their knowledge, passion and advice really makes Rome come alive. Now down to the hotel itself. The hotel is a little way from the centre of Rome, if by centre you meant the Roman Forum but there is plenty of historical and artistic merit on your door step practically. The area is nowhere near as bad as I expected, it is a little run down but then so is most of Rome outside of the big tourist venues, it is safe, clean and populated with several restaurants and shops. It is also perfect for the station. The hotel itself is basic, but I would have put it at 3 rather than 2 stars, it is small but clean and the beds and noise proofing were great, I slept better than I do on our fancy memory foam mattress at home. The juice and croissants in the morning are a nice touch and while the reception area might not be to my taste it give the place character. In summary a comfortable bed, a reasonable price, reasonably situated hotel great hosts and even better advice

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, wonderful hosts”
Reviews.Author: AandMLoveTravel
Reviews.Content: The downsides: hard beds, super noisy, small showers- however this was our experience in almost all our Italian hotels so expect it unless you're paying a lot more. The staff of the hotel was excellent, giving us almost too much information on where to go and what to see! They were helpful and courteous throughout our stay and were genuinely concerned that we were comfortable and happy. The hotel was an excellent value, very clean and well appointed for a budget hotel. I have recommended it to several friends since our stay. Perfectly positioned for siteseeing pretty much everything in Rome, we were able to walk to nearly all our destinations in less than half an hour. No breakfast but who needs it with several inexpensive cafes nearby for a shot of espresso and a pastry?

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Service in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kevinpng
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews. I was perhaps a little sceptical given that Welrome is such a small hotel. However, all of the reviews are accurate - the hotel is very comfortable and clean, the location is good (both for arrival by train but also in terms of easy access to key tourist sites) and Mary and Carlos are outstanding hosts. The property is 2 star so this needs to be kept in mind - if you want 5* standard then pay the 5* price. However, the service and standard of the hotel far exceeds that of a standard Rome 2* hotel and I would personally stay here over a much more expensive hotel if I was to visit Rome again. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “It's all true!”
Reviews.Author: Semi-retiredOntario
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Welrome Hotel with Mary and Carlo at the first of May. Before making our reservation we read all of the reviews, and I can assure you, the comments are accurate. It's all true! We must thank Mary and Carlo for helping to make our stay in Rome so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky place to be when you are stranded”
Reviews.Author: lelgil
Reviews.Content: All the other reviews I have read are true. The Welrome Hotel lived up to its reputation of being a welcome, friendly place. Mary and Carlo were informative and concerned about our vacation. They really wanted us to have a good time and save money. Two remarkable things they did for us: when they realized that we could not get wireless internet in our room because the signal was weak, they bought a booster which plugged into the wall in our room and gave us what we needed. It turned out that we really needed to use the internet as we were stranded in Rome during one of the volanic eruptions. Mary and Carlo made sure we could stay, and the second remarkable thing: they even reduced the price of the room after my son got an earlier flight back the the USA. Many other hotels in Italy were jacking up their prices while Mary and Carlo were busy accommodating our needs at a very fair price. I would happily stay here again. Thank you, Mary and Carlo, for taking care of our family!

Reviews.Title: “Does everything possible to make your stay perfect”
Reviews.Author: hippo63
Reviews.Content: Before we even got to the hotel Mary had recommended various places to visit. We were so glad she did as we booked the tour to visit the Necropolis under the Basilica well in advance and the tour on the day was superb. The hotel itself is easy to find following Marys instructions and is approx 10 mins from the termini. We took the train from the airport costing 30Euros for the 2 of us, the trains was very busy so we had to stand for the 30 minute journey. For our return we took a taxi costing 55euros. Location wise, the hotel was fairly central, and a walk to the Colesseum, Roman Forum, Pantheon was approx 20-25 mns. My hubby and I visited Rome for our wedding aniversary and Mary arrived with a small bottle of champagne after we had checked in and the following day (our anniversary) we returned from our sight-seeing to find sugar almond flowers by our bed. Mary and Carlos couldnt do enough to recommend places to visit and gave us routes to follow on free maps they kindly provided. On a wet morning Mary even lent me her umbrella so we wouldnt get wet. We had Pantheon room which had double bed and ensuite bathroom. The room wasnt large but was perfectly adequate for our needs. The bed was made up daily and towels also changed daily. Coffee and tea is provided in the room. Our room faced the street but after closing the shutters and the double glazed windows the street noise was minimal. Breakfast is not included but every morning we were left croissant and juice in a basket outside our room. The hotel has only 7 rooms and we didnt have any noise from our neighbours. The hotel also offered free wifi which was great for keeping in touch with our family. We ate out every night and would definately recommend the Restaurant Wanted which is situated on Via Leonina close to the Colosseum, they do fab pizzas and soups and is reasonably priced for Rome. There is a Hard rock Cafe close by but unfortunately was very busy by the time we arrived and we couldnt get a table. Would definately recommend a stay here, the owners go out of their way to try and make your stay perfect

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel has it all”
Reviews.Author: deandownunder
Reviews.Content: In planning a short duration visit to Rome, one has to take into consideration location. Location to transport, major sights, restaurants, shopping etc. Cost and room facilities are also very important as Rome is an expensive city. The Welrome has all this and more. Mary and Carlo are exceptional hosts, always ready to provide information and maps to make your vacation smooth and pleasant. The room was comfortable, quiet and very clean. The continental breakfast was very welcome. No doubt there are more upmarket places to stay in Rome but you will not find one that offers as much as the Welrome.

Reviews.Title: “The Welrome deserves to be #1!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuru1020
Reviews.Content: The Welrome hotel lived up to and exceeded my expectations. If you are looking for luxury, look elsewhere. However, if you are looking for a very clean room with basic amenities, convenient to both transportation and most tourist attractions then this hotel should meet your needs. What puts this hotel in a class by itself are the proprietors, Mary and Carlo. They are two of the nicest, most genuine people I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. Without repeating many of the details mentioned, they truly look out for your every need. At the end of our long days we were always greeted at the door and it felt as if we were returning home! I learned a great deal about the culture and history of Rome from our many chats with them. They are amazing people who are very proud of their city and want you to experience everything it has to offer. We very much look forward to returning to Rome and will most certainly look to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place - Home Away from home!”
Reviews.Author: olivellam
Reviews.Content: We trusted the advice from TripAdvisor reviews and that was the best decision about the Italy trip. Right from the day we landed till the day we left, we were very impressed with the hospitality showered on us by Mary and Carlos. To begin with, the location was excellent, walking distance to Termini and National Museum and a lot of good restaraunts. The rooms were clean, towels changed everyday. Her email read that breakfast will not be served, however the croissant and juice was filling as a breakfast. Mary was very helpful, the day we landed she made sure we had a briefing about Rome, told us about the supermarket and the laundromat that the hotel uses. Turned out that the laundromart was pretty close by, just dump the clothes, pay him and clean clothes waiting for you when you return! We even finished our laundry the day before we left and had minimum set of dirty clothes when we came back home! The room had a kettle, mini refrigerator and minimum supply of sugar, coffee and tea. My kids drink warm milk in the morning and in the nights. I asked her if she could help me, she provided me a kettle with which I could boil milk everyday to make coffee for us and milk for the kids. That was very sweet of her to go that extra mile to make sure we were not hungry! Everyday morning she would greet us and the kids and when we return in the evening she would be waiting to ask the kids about their day, where they went etc. The kids have grown very fond of her, they were looking forward to talk to her in the evenings! The final day we left was a rainy day and in the hurry we missed taking a picture with Mary and Carlos. My older son was very upset that we could not get a picture. We are sure we will return to Italy and to this hotel in particular, we have a very valid reason now!!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay in Rome - a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DanceCharades
Reviews.Content: Welrome has a very convenient location right near to Termini station (the only station where the 2 metro lines intersect and you can get trains directly to/from Fiumicino airport) and the owners Mary and Carlo make you feel very welcome. The rooms are clean and are equipped with a kettle, tea and coffee, a safe, a TV and air con. Mary and Carlo are very happy to spend time giving you lots of tips on where to visit and the best places to eat - even giving you a map - which was really helpful. They say they don't provide breakfast but put a little basket with some pastries and orange juice in it outside our room in the morning which was great. I would definitely recommend Welrome - it is a small, friendly hotel with a very convenient location. Thanks Mary and Carlo!

Reviews.Title: “These hosts make this hotel the best!”
Reviews.Author: Higgs33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days in late March. Mary and Carlo were the kindest hosts I have encountered. if you are looking for a high quality hotel with ammenities this may not be for you, but if you are looking for a friendly, helpful atmosphere you are at the right address. These hosts literally give you information on every aspect of touring in Italy. They will set up private tours for you or give you the information needed to go on your own. They are very economic and try to save you money every step of the way. This was our first trip abroad and neither of us speak a foreign language. They were lifesavers. I felt that I could trust their judgement and was more comfortable with the decisions we made with their guidance. For a do it yourself traveler who has never been to Rome, I highly recommend Mary and Carlo and their hotel. If you have already made all your plans, you may appreciate a different location. Their valuable guidance made up for the imperfections of the room. Mary did serve us breakfast every morning. i highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Welrome Hotel a great ambassador for Rome.”
Reviews.Author: qldtravellers40
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights at the Welrome Hotel in March after reading many positive reviews on trip advisor and we were not disappointed. Firstly, the location of the hotel was very convenient to the main train station, Termini and we were able to walk to all the major attractions, Colosseum, Roman Forum, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. We did use the metro to visit the Vatican Museum, but actually walked home. On our arrival, Mary marked out all the places of interest on a map for us, recommended a couple of restaurants and gave us the location of the nearby supermarket so we could organise some food for breakfast. What a surprise in the morning when we found some juice and pastries on the table outside our room and we actually got this surprise each morning of our stay.On returning one evening, utterly exhausted, Carlo asked us about our plans for the following day. When we told him we were visiting the Vatican Museum, he brought out some books and pointed out the highlights of what we could expect to see. The information he gave us in those 15 minutes made such a difference to our Museum visit. He is obviously very passionate about art and he managed to pass on some valuables tips prior to our visit. Thanks to Mary's advice to pre-book tickets to the Vatican, we saved ourselves a 2 - 3 hour wait. The rooms at the hotel are certainly not luxurious, so they would not suit everyone, but our room was clean, quiet with a comfortable bed. What more do you need when travelling. We hope to return one day and we will certainly stay at the Welrome Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Different Strokes”
Reviews.Author: eurolady28
Reviews.Content: I am still mystified at how this hotel holds on to its number one rating...while the owners are helpful...not any more so than other hotels in Rome....I found the room cleanliness definitely lacking. the rooms are well worn and unattractive....there was mold in the shower and a lot of dust on the shelves. We are independent travelers that go for clean, safe and location.....not fancy or luxurious so I don't think our standards are beyond expectation......so just be aware....this place is more hostel than hotel.

Reviews.Title: “At home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Family582
Reviews.Content: The Welrome Hotel is a small, 7 room hotel, located within a few minute walk to the main train station in Rome. Follow the simple directions which are sent to you with your hotel reservation. The hotel is run by very caring inn keepers Mary and Carlo. It is Mary and Carlo's love and knowledge of this city, and the concern they have for each of their guests, that makes the stay at the Welrome Hotel so special. As the front entrance of this hotel is locked for safety and security reasons, Mary or Carlo greet each guest when they return or leave the facility. Mary and Carlo are always willing to share their knowledge and love of their city with directions, advice about where to visit or where to eat, hidden "treasures" in Rome, recommendations for tours and how to most easily reach your chosen destinations. My husband and I chose to walk almost everywhere-- even the Vatican-- which is located on the other side of the city. We enjoyed the many churches, fountains, stores and restaurants as we were not usually hurried. The metro station is also located nearby. As this was our first trip to Italy and Rome we were unsure about what to expect. Thank you so very much to Mary and Carlo for helping to make this experience better than we expected!! I am not sure if a bigger or fancier hotel could possibly beat the warmth and caring we felt from these wonderful and caring hosts. Your kindness was truly appreciated!!

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: Kiev2010
Reviews.Content: We love traveling, and have done it a lot. We have stayed in many hotels, B&Bs in the USA and Europe. Welrome is, by far, the best place we have ever stayed in. The hotel is situated 7 minutes within walking distance of Termini train station where you can also catch any bus you need to go anywhere. Termini station also is a large unexpensive shoping and dining area by itself. The hotel is also located within 20 minutes by foot of a lot of major attractions. The area surrounding the hotel is safe day and night. There are a few cheap shops where you can get a breakfast/sandwich/coffe/gelato just around the corner of the hotel. We occupied Spana room--it was absolutely clean, had a liitle TV, AC that you could adjust yourself, 3 beds, small refrigerator, small table, 4 chairs, electric teapot, tea cups, small tray with goodies (tea bags, coffee bags, sugar, juices, etc) that Mrs De Rosa kindly refilled every day. The bathroom was shiny and sparkly, and put my own bathroom at home to shame:) But the best part is the owners of the hotel. Both are wonderful, receptive, sweet, intelligent, going-out-of-their way, friendliest people. We cannot thank them both enough for making our stay in Rome feel safe, feel at home, feel loved and appreciated. We received the most personal attention to every need we had, detailed answers to all our questions, and the entire experience just blessed our hearts. Next time we are in Rome, we will only stay in Welrome. We highly recommend the hotel to all our fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “2 STAR HOTEL WITH 5 STAR SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: AL2015
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in the Spagna room and had a fantastic time. Carlo and Mary were always on hand to offer advice on great restaurants and places to see. The moment we arrived, Mary produced one of her famous maps and immediately started to point out the main places of interest. It's fair to say that the 20 minutes spent going over the map with her helped us to hit the ground running. We had also pre booked to see that Vatican museum and Carlo insisted on speaking with us before we went. He spent an hour giving us invaluable tips on what we should look out for. He is very passionate and knowledgeable about Roman history and art, so his advice made our visit that much better and saved us the expense (20 Euro per person) of using a guide. Mary recommended several restaurants and perhaps just as importantly advised against others. She based this advice on the feedback from previous guests. We took her advice and were very pleased. Prior to our trip I was concerned about the cost of eating out. I had travelled with my wife and two teenage daughters. As a result of reading some reviews on trip advisor, I expected to pay between 100 - 140 Euro for dinner. In fact, we paid an average of 70 Euro for all four of us and that included a couple of starters, 4 main courses (Pasta or Pizza) and deserts. We also had a bottle of wine, a beer and a couple of soft drinks with evening meals. Mary recommended the restaurants and we were never disappointed. I think it is important to point out that the hotel, although spotlessly clean, is basic. If you are looking for a hotel with a lounge/bar and restuarant then this is not for you. Our room accommodated the four of us but we had to share a small wardrobe. We had to use our suitcases to store our clothes - but this is a small price to pay for the incredible service. We loved Rome - it exceeded our expectations by a long way and I would have no hesitation in recommending the Welrome. Thank you Mary and Carlo for making our stay so enjoyable, it would not have been the same without your advice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hosts; Great Value in a Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul5795
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Rome with our two children, both of whom were on spring break from University. We stayed at the Welrome hotel for seven nights, from March 6 until the 13th. We chose the Welrome in large part because of previous TripAdvisor reviews. The Welrome is actually more like a “Bed and Breakfast” than like a typical hotel. The Welrome has only seven rooms, all located on the second floor (in the USA, that means one level up from the ground floor), and is owned and run by two excellent hosts: Mary and Carlo. And even though the Welrome is advertised as not having any “breakfast,” Mary brought us a pastry and some juice each morning, which we enjoyed with the in-room instant coffee and tea. On our first day, we arrived rather late in the afternoon, about 5 PM, and took a cab to the hotel (40 Euros flat rate from the airport). When we arrived, Mary hauled out a tourist map and told us how to get to the local supermarket (two blocks away), recommended a place to eat (the Ristorante di Giovanni), and then diagrammed several walks we could take after dinner. After cleaning up, we went to the supermarket, and picked up wine, crackers, cheese, and salami at good prices, just like Mary said we would. Then we headed back out to dinner at Di Giovanni, about four blocks away. Just as advertised, it was very good -- and reasonably priced too. We ordered a litre of the house red wine, and a litre of the house white, each for only 6 Euros and each very good. The total bill, which included the wine, first, seconds, and dessert for four persons – all excellent -- was only 86 Euros. Again, very nice. Then we stumbled back to the hotel, where we were met by Carlo, who wanted to know what our plans were for our stay and then outlined another nice walking route for the next day (our first full day). In fact, throughout the remainder of our stay both Mary and Carlo were full of great ideas for what to see and do. They love their city of Rome, and it shows. My wife and I stayed in the San Pietro room, and our kids stayed in the Colosseo room. Each room had three single beds, with two pushed together to make a larger bed, and the bed mattresses were nice and firm. The rooms were both good size, I think, for European standards, measuring about 11 feet by 14 feet, not including a short entryway and a the bathroom. The room ceilings were very high, maybe also about 11 feet. The floors were red tile, and the walls were painted yellow. The rooms are nicely furnished, but the furnishings are older and relatively plain. The tables, beds, cabinets, TV, bedspreads, and curtains, heating and cooling controls, light fixtures, and even the light switches are all functional but dated. The TV, for example, is small, with only a 12 inch screen, and the cable has one English-language channel, BBC World. So if you are looking for a modern or luxurious hotel room with the latest in furnishings and amenities, this is not the place for you. But if you are looking for a clean, pleasant hotel in a good location with two super nice hosts, heh, this could be the place. And who goes to Rome to watch the TV??? The two rooms were fairly quiet. Although our room faced the street, there was little in the way of noise, as the hotel is on a narrow, one way, side street so there is very little traffic noise. We did hear some noise one night in which a large group of students staying at the hotel across the street were out and about. Our kids’ room faced the back and they reported no noise from the courtyard. Although the nights were cold, the heating system worked well. The free wireless internet also worked fine. The wi fi signal worked in both rooms, and the speed and signal strength were adequate for what we needed (mostly checking email and looking up some things about Rome on the web). The bathroom was also fine. The shower was small, but there was plenty of hot water and good water pressure, even when the four of us were all getting ready at about the same time. The bathroom was clean, although there was a small amount of mildew around the bottom of the shower and up on the ceiling above the shower. My wife used the hairdryer (a wall mounted unit, again, somewhat dated) and had to play with it a bit to keep it working by continuously holding the hot air hose away from the wall. She did figure out how to do that. The Welrome location is a good one. Rome is made for walking, and just about everything was accessible from the Welrome by a short walk. For example, the Coliseum and the ancient area of Rome is a 25 minute walk to the southwest, the Presidential palace a 15 minute walk to the west, the Trevi fountain a 20 minute walk to the west, the Spanish steps a 25 minute walk to the northwest, and the Galleria Borghese a 15 minute walk due north. Other interesting sites are even closer, with, for example, the National Roman History museum just around the block from Welrome. In fact, the only “major” attraction that was too far away for walking was the Vatican, but that is easily accessible by metro (subway). The main train station (Termini) is a five minute walk away from the Welrome. The two Rome subway lines form a large “X” with the intersection of the “X” at Termini, so you can catch the subway to wherever it goes. Having read the lousy TripAdvisor reviews about the Archeobus and the 110 Tram, we bought tickets on the “Roma Christiana,” a different “hop-on hop-off bus” (one day pass 16 Euro, three day pass 25 Euro). This particular bus stopped just three blocks from the Welrome, and worked fine for us when we wanted to get a general overview of the city and get over to see the Vatican. As for food, we had several picnics in our room to keep costs down. Aside from the Di Giovanni, we ate dinner in two other nearby restaurants: Babbos (just around the corner from the Welrome) and the Trattoria Pretoriana (about three blocks from the Welrome). All three restaurants were good. Babbos was slightly better than the other two in terms of the excellence of the food, but was also a little pricier mostly because their wine was more expensive. For me, Di Giovanni’s was the best value in terms of balancing quality and cost. When I get around to it, I will post separate reviews on each restaurant. I should also mention La Famiglia Ristorante, a restaurant which is immediately adjacent to the Welrome. It looked very nice through the windows, and seemed to have lots of diners.
