But the restaurant has some pretty lousy reviews on TripAdvisor that imply that, as far as service goes, it favors the locals and doesn’t really treat tourists well. In any event, Mary and Carlo did not specifically recommend the La Famiglia so we did not try it. Mary and Carlo keep the front door to the hotel locked at all times, and they keep control of the keys when you leave. That is fine, as one of them seemed to be readily accessible at whenever we wanted to come or go. Still it is probably good, if you can, to let them know exactly when you plan to return. Also, we noticed that on the hotel stairs the handrail does not begin at the top of the stairs but only after three or four steps down. Mary and Carlo really should think about adding a short handrail extension at the top of the stairs. To sum it up, we really enjoyed our stay in Rome and we highly recommend the Welrome Hotel, Mary, and Carlo!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience in Europe”
Reviews.Author: rocketsfan007
Reviews.Content: I am a student in London and have been traveling around the Continent as much as I can. Of all the places I have been so far, Hotel Welrome has been the BEST lodging experience so far. I made my choice based on Lonely Planet and Trip Advisor reviews and was completely satisfied. Mary and Carlo, the proprietors, are two of the sweetest people I have ever met. Upon our arrival, Mary spent about a half hour suggesting different sightseeing routes and giving us the ins and outs of our room. Every time we returned to the hotel one of them was at the door to greet us with a smile and ask how our day was and what we saw. Mary even brought us breakfast each of our three mornings! They were an absolute delight and had wonderful recommendations for restaurants and bars in the area. The hotel is about a 7 minute walk from Termini Stazione, very easy to find. it is also a 7 minute walk to Republica, a very convenient metro stop to venture around Rome. We stayed in the 3 person room, which was quite spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was always clean and adequate. The room had a safe, tv, air conditioner/heater, telephone, alarm clock, etc. Again the highlight of the stay is interacting with Mary and Carlo.They truly care about their guests and do their best to make your stay as comfortable as possible. I would certainly recommend Welrome to anyone and stay there again if and when I return to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: kwerty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Welrome Hotel for 3 nights and were impressed with the cleanliness of our room and the attentiveness of our hosts. The free internet worked perfectly, too. Before we arrived I was a bit concerned about the location, as rail station neighborhoods tend to be a bit rough, but we had no problem here, even at night. We chose the Welrome because it was a short walk to the Termini Station and the Airport Express train. We were able to walk to all of our chosen destinations in Rome, although there were convenient buses too. I was so pleased with our experience I have already reserved a room there for my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: tpick63
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights with Mary and Carlo at their wonderful little hotel while visiting Rome. The hotel was centrally located aprox. 4-5 minute walk from main train terminal, making arrival, departure and local sightseeing very easy. Mary and Carlo were very helpful and informative with what sights to see and the easiest ways to access them. Carlo's knowledge and passion for his city, is particularly evident with his detailed descriptions of the sights. Mary also goes out of her way to make sure your stay is very comfortable. The room was always very clean and cozy. I hope to get back soon to see my new friends.

Reviews.Title: “Home sweet Home with simply the best hosts ever”
Reviews.Author: majorbrown
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed for 7 nights and we was overwhelmed with the local knowledge from our hosts who went out of their way to make you feel extra special. They gave you good directions on maps, great local restaurant reccommendations, You was cared for just as if you were one of the family. The whole experience of being in this italian hotel situated in Rome was excellent. Anyone staying at this hotel would not be disappointed. We would most definately stay their in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: Joy116
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at welrome for one night and then promptly switched hotels. Yes it is true that the hosts are very helpful, if not overly so. But when the host of your hotel is constantly telling you to be careful over and over again and then pulls out a map of all the places in Rome you should stay away from, which by the way was basically a big circle around the hotel, it's not very comforting. Welrome is not in a good location in Rome. It is not near any of the main attractions. Yes it is near the train station but for all of us who live in big cities know, you don't want to stay anywhere near a train station. Even our cab driver told us this is not a good section of Rome. The room was a standard European hotel room with less than acceptable cleanliness. The drain in the shower had hair in it and I consistently found other people's hair in the sheets and blankets of my bed. I would say only stay in this hotel if you are staying in Rome for one night and want to be near the train station. Otherwise stay in a safer, more centrally located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend Welrome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkMJapan
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for six nights. Everything is as written in other reviews (Mary and Carlo, the kindness, the cleanliness, the room's size, etc.). Despite I felt the people in Rome a little bit rude (not really kind, in my opinion), Mary and Carlo are just the opposite. I also would recommend the Ristorante Da Giovanni, few blocks from Welrome. Thank you very much Mary and Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location, and very knowlegeable hosts.”
Reviews.Author: Houdini13
Reviews.Content: Carlo and Mary want you to fall in love with Rome. They offered many excellant suggestions for where to go, when to go, how to go, where to eat, etc. On our last day we picked up a rental car at the Termini. Carlo's directions on how to safely get out of Rome and headed towards Florence were flawless. Can't say enough good things about the Welrome. Also, there is an Eritrean (Ethiopian) restaurant, I think the name was ASMARA, about three blocks north and east of the hotel that is excellant!

Reviews.Title: “Seriously the best hosts ever”
Reviews.Author: crab67tkf
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Welrome from Florence and found the place very easily from the station. We were greeted by Mary and shown where we were on the map, where the nearest supermercato was and shown to our room. we had a quad so it had a very big bathroom and the room was big too with a little fridge, t.v., and free internet access. Within 10 minutes of arriving Mary knocked at the door with a pandoro (italian cake), a kettle, tea bags and coffee and sugar. We were so touched. We had this for breakfast each of the 3 mornings we were there. The fridge came in handy for the goodies we bought from the supermarket and saved us a fortune. I asked Mary where the local laundry was and she said to go around the corner and Hasan will take care of it. I did and Hasan said leave it with me and come back in 3 hours which I did and he had washed, dried and packed all our laundry. Not only did he save us hanging around his price was 18 Euro ($28 AUD) for a heap of clothes (about 2 1/2 loads). So grateful. Mary kindly suggested a very nice restaurant to eat at on our final night which was in walking distance called Restaurante Da Giovani. The kids spaghetti was under cooked but that's Italy but my cutlet and my husbands roast pork were so yummy. On our final morning my husband finally met Carlos and was disappointed he hadn't met him earlier. He said he was so full of information and showed him a lot of books he had. Thanks so much Mary for your kindness and caring nature you showed our family and to Carlo for his knowledge. We took the tour buses to see the sites and got on and off when we wanted at the stops of the sites we wanted to see. On the last day we sat on the Archaelogical bus and listened to the comentary. Half way you get off for a coffee at a little shop and get back on again to head back to the start. That was a nice way to finish our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Home at Welrome”
Reviews.Author: Emil_Pa
Reviews.Content: Mary & Carlo are the reason this hotel is rated #1, I've stayed in hotels in London, Paris, Florence, and all over the US, and no where in my travels to Europe have I found a more inviting place to call homebase. Service: Upon arrival we were not just given a map but presented with a map. We were shown our relation to close landmarks and sights, as well as provided with tips on how to save money and time on our stay. Basically anytime we headed out Carlo was there to provide some history, point out some highlights on our way to our destination. That's service. Rooms: Clean, comfortable, quiet. When in Rome... I don't plan on staying in, I do however expect a place to all that Welrome is. Bed was comfortable, not completely firm like most beds in Europe, especially for a side sleeper like me. Sheets were clean, furniture was basic. TV had cable, and atleast 1 channel, BBC in English. There was a place to hang my clothes as well as a safe to put things in, and a fridge to put food in. Bathroom was clean, and also basic. Location: Really close to Roma Termini, however, its on the less dodgy side or the tracks. Did not feel unsafe at anytime around where the hotel is located. Real close to the Metro so most sights are real close. Albeit maybe a bit farther off if you were to walk Rome, as I did. Amenities: Besides the room, and the concierge like Mary and Carlo, none. Carlo was friendly enough to help with the bags, Mary was kind enough to point out the supermarket around the corner where we stocked up on snacks and water. But I may point out that during our stay Mary and Carlo were uber nice to provide fresch croissants and juice boxes every morning our entire stay. Value: Can't be beat. Trust me, if I had an endless supply of dough, would I stay here? probably not, I'd probably be at a posh hotel near the spanish steps or city center. but I don't so I need to make sure my money takes me a long way, which it does here. Overall opinion: I would stay here again. I would recommend this place in a heartbeat to any of my friends and family planning to go to Rome. Sometimes you get what you pay for, if it were just the room then I would say it's fine enough for the money, however, Mary and Carlo are what give really make this place extra special and deserving of its high rating. Don't be afraid to book here if planning to go to Rome, unless you are looking for a 5-star hotel or a short walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “A Rick Steves kind of place !”
Reviews.Author: algis
Reviews.Content: We stayed with Mary & Carlos prior to a cruise vacation. I say Mary & Carlos instead of Hotel ,because that is what it felt like, a residence instead of a hotel. True ,the rooms and showers were 'European sized,' but Mary and & Carlos more than made up for it ,with their expansive knowledge, advice and enthusiasm for their city of Rome. Ciao Bella ! is a greeting usually reserved for friends, which we felt we were, when we departed....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location, but excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: noclue78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in mid-October. The room is small as is the bathroom, but from what I hear, this is normal for European hotels. The bathroom did have a bit of mold around the base of the shower stall. The rest of the room was kept very clean during our stay. Both Mary and Carlo went out of their way to make us feel like family I would say. Mary spent about 1/2 hour with us the day we arrived making sure we knew our way around. Carlo did the same one night upon our return for the evening. He pointed out some of Romes greatest churhces to visit. At his suggestion, we visited about a dozen churches on our last day in Rome and saw some amazing art. Mary gave us some good advise for saving money on breakfast, we went to the local supermarket and bought juice, yogurt and and fruit and had breakfast in our room. The location was good. A short walk from the Termini train station. We didn't feel unsafe at all walking to and from anytime of the day. At the Termini you can catch either subway line and many bus lines. I recommend the Roma Pass if you will be using Public transit and visiting any of the sites included on the Roma Pass. Please don't expect a 5 star room here, but if you're looking for a convenient place to sleep each night in room at an excellent price, this is the place for you! Mary will feel like your Italian grandmother!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing compares...Welrome Hotel Raised the bar on superior service”
Reviews.Author: Amma24
Reviews.Content: My twin sister and friends recommended the Welrome Hotel during their stay early in the Fall. Together with my research on Trip Advisor's, I decided to make a reservation. My husband and I were traveling with my Mother and brother and were slightly concerned they might find it to up to their "standards". Well I could not have been more pleased. Mary and Carlos delivered top quality service. The rooms were more than we expected. To travel half way across the world and feel nutured and cared for by hotel staff is a rarity these days. I travel a fair bit on business and working in the sales training and development business, I wish all sales reps could see this superior service in action. The bar has been raised on superior service and truly genuine caring staff. Merry Christmas Mary and Carlos. You are truly #1.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever!”
Reviews.Author: juzatourist
Reviews.Content: It's true - everything that's been said about Welrome, Mary and Carlos. While I do not want to repeat it all, I feel it would not do their good work justice, so here're the 5 things we love about Welrome. 1) Location - short walk from Termini station with the metro and train close enough yet without the riff-raff you might be worried about. Supermarket and cafes/restaurants just round a couple of corners. 2) Lift - for those of you with huge and heavy luggage, you'll appreciate not having to lug it up the flight of steps. The lift is sort of in the next building but they're connected to Welrome. 3) Room - comfortable size with small TV, fridge, safe, small table and chairs. Double shutters/windows shut out noise at night. Air conditioning available. Shower stall is a bit small but that's the standard size in Italy 4) Help in planning trip - Mary and Carlos help you to plan your days in Rome the moment you arrive, with great suggestions on tour routes, getting the most out of your stay, economical options e.g. Roma pass, bus routes. Great advice on visiting the Vatican, shopping, eating out 5) Great initiative by Mary and Carlos - we had an early flight and departure. Mary brought up a tray of coffee and snacks, much to our delight!\ If you MUST be picky, I suppose some travellers prefer to go it their own and not have someone help them out that much and shower them with advice... We love and miss Welrome, we'll be back if that coin into the Trevi works!

Reviews.Title: “ratings winner”
Reviews.Author: nelson-7
Reviews.Content: Really excellent little hotel; I stayed in this place on the basis of the phenomenal reviews, and I have to say it met expectations in every respect. A perfect place to stay to explore a great city.

Reviews.Title: “What everyone else says is true; it desrves to be No 1”
Reviews.Author: BigTregs
Reviews.Content: I can add little to what has been said about Carlo and Mary by everyone else. Incredibly helpful and proud of Rome and they seem genuinely pleased when you discuss where you have been and what you have seen. They certainly contributed to out stay and we shall remember them fondly. If only all hotel owners could be like them.... Now the hotel itself. First find it! We walked past it twice before we saw the door. It is right next door to the famiglia Restaurant ( of which more below). The area is OK without being the Via Veneto. One or two friendly(!) ladies around at night and the odd cardboard city resident - but not as bad as the areas nearer the station. Well lit and perfectly safe to walk around in even quite late. The room (Coilsseo) was spotlessly clean, immaculately serviced for the eight days we were there, sufficiently large and generally quiet. It is 2 star and not boutique. If we have any criticism, there is little storage space; and the towels are a bit small. But that might be picky. TV so I kept up with Champions League, fridge and well lit Mary directs you to Li Roong over the road for breakfast. They are terrific. Best coffee I've had for a long long time and puts Starbucks and the rest in their place. And a super atmosphere in the morning with people coming and going. And very reasonable too. Eating nearby is hit and miss. the Famiglia next door is a throughput restaurant with arrogant staff though the food is OK. The Chinese along the street from Welrome is adequate -just. The Abyssinian just opposite was an experiment and was awful -their definition if steak tartare seems to be minced beef. The William (?) at the end of Via Volturno opposite the railway station was expensive and poor - and don't visit the toilets unless you absolutely have to, they will put you off your meal. More expensive but superb is Babbos 50 yards from Li Roong. At £80 for two for three courses and wine not bad at all by capital city prices. Ambience, staff, quality if food superb. I'd pay more here in the backwoods of England for that quality. Recommended strongly. But back to the Welrome. If I come to Rome again, I shall book the Welrome. I've already recommended it twice to friends, something I rarely do with hotels

Reviews.Title: “Made the holiday so much better...”
Reviews.Author: Aus_Nomads
Reviews.Content: Well, the room and bathroom is small and cosy, but it is also clean, comfortable, in a great location, and most importantly - quiet. As everyone has mentioned before, it's the service and the very helpful information that Mary and Carlo also provide, which made our holiday so exceptional. In fact late one night, Carlo gave us a very special indoctrination into visiting the Vatican museum / Sistine Chapel and St Peter's Basilica. I must admit, Carlo's passion for the Sistine Chapel certainly rubbed off, and we had a better appreciation for the finer details of the museum. Mary's guidance to the important places around the area and the vicinity to the tourist attractions was so useful, we felt quite at home with the location. Mary was even able to provided us with tea making facilities, which always gets a extra star in our eyes. As we have also been "inducted" into Mary and Carlo's extended world-wide family, we thank them for their hospitality and assistance in making our holiday so much more memorable. We hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “At Welrome - at home with friends.”
Reviews.Author: Adel-Lad
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Rome and we were apprehensive from the warnings and tips from guidebooks and well meaning friends. A friend recommended Welrome after a visit in 2007, and her views were supported by the many assurances on TripAdvisor and in Lonely Planet. The owners of this small family hotel, Mary and Carlo take great pride in welcoming guests and helping them to have the best possible time during their stay. Mary's immediate and detailed response to my initial enquiries and request for accomodation did much to assure me that we would be in good hands - as indeed we were. We were greeted by name at the front door when we arrived, given appropriate advice about keeping safe on the streets, shown how everything worked, and given a wealth of advice on local sightseeing. Mary and Carlo love their Rome, and their Italian heriatge, and enthustiastically share it with guests who are soon made to feel like valued friends. The front desk is like a small tourism / information / education centre - a valuable resource for a visitor new to the streets and ways of Rome. We were given excellent advice on all manner of things - right down to where to find the finest gelato we have ever tasted. Carlo prepared us for visits to various sights (especially Vatican Museum and Sistine Chapel) by bringing out art & architecture books from his collection, and pointing out special features to watch for on visits. Carlo would not only tell you where to find a certain attraction, but tell you about it, and put it into its cultural & historical context. It was always a great joy discussing where we were about to go, and on our return sharing impressions. Our adult son was with us for 2 days of our stay. On the morning he left at 5:30 to catch the train to the airport, Mary was watching out to ensure that he was not late, and gave him some fresh pastries to take and eat for his early start breakfast. Although just a small gesture, it was typical of the thoughtful hospitality shown to us, and (from the reviews) many other guests at their hotel. Now for the hotel itself. It is a comfortable and simple small hotel of 2-star rating. In general, the rooms in 2-star hotels we visited were quite a squeeze, so we were very pleased to find a room (the "Spagna" family 4 bed family room) of a generous size, with a roomy lobby where cases could be stored, and a good-sized bathroom. The shutters and glazed windows keep out unwanted noise - not that the street is particularly busy. The hotel is an easy 10 minute case-pull from the Termini Station, and is well located. In a few minutes you can walk to caffes, bars, restaurants, supermarket, laundromat and other facilities. All manner of important attractions are within half an hours walk of the hotel - just follow the clear directions on the maps Mary and Carlo will give you! The difference between this hotel and some other places we stayed in could not be more marked. Hotel Welrome - you deserve your No 1 Popularity Rating. Well done Mary and Carlos, and thankyou for your wonderful hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: frankderf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here two years ago and thought it was great. The staff of two, are great with helping you navigate. Sometimes too great as you just want to get out and go, but they mean well. So this is a great place with great staff, but do note, you are in Rome! If you want to stay in a luxury hotel this is not that. It is a small boutique style hotel. The rooms are small, and it can be a bit loud at times. With that said, we were in our rooms 7 - 9 hours a day, too sleep and too shower. So it worked out great. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: sicamous
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the reviews on TripAdvisor, we chose the Welrome for the start of our holiday in Italy. It was everything we had hoped for. Very reasonably priced, close to the main rail station (5 min walk), within easy walking distance of major sites, close to metro station, supermarket, and restaurants. Room amenities include a safe , hairdryer, and refrigerator. With windows closed, very quiet. Beds comfy, bedside lighting great. And the best thing about the Welrome was Mary who was so helpful and kind. The fellow was also very nice though he wasn't present as often as Mary during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I found this hotel on Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: Myfirsttriptorome
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for luxury and a spotless location then look elsewhere. But if you want a charming hotel with spot on service and a great location you have found your home in the Welrome Hotel. The fabulous staff with take care of all your needs whether it be directions, recommendations of good restaurants or reservations at one of the many museums. Though the rooms are not large they are adequate and well maintained. And given the reasonable price you cannot do any better in this high cost city. Do yourself a favor and pick this home away from home on your next special trip to Rome - we certainly will.

Reviews.Title: “Our home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: HappyCanadian2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 2 boys visited Rome in late July 2009. We were very fortunate to have stayed with Carlo and Mary. They are not only knowledgeable but exceptionally kind and helpful. They made us feel like staying with good friends. The location is excellent and Termini station is just 5 minutes away. We really enjoyed our stay there and will definately stay with Welrome again if we ever visit Rome again. Mary and Carlo, thank you again and hope to visit you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome, spotless and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: LinNewcastleuponTyne
Reviews.Content: Clear directions meant that we found this hotel easily, five minutes from Termini. We were welcomed warmly by Carlo, who made sure that we knew where everything was and how it worked.(Shower, air-con etc..) The room (the 'Trevi') was not huge, but was spotless, with fridge and safe, and a modern bathroom. The shutters and double-glazing provided excellent light and sound insulation. Both Carlo and Mary made every effort to make our stay an enjoyable and culturally rewarding one; both are obviously passionate about their city and will provide you with a wealth of helpful advice and information.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay and wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne001
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled to this hotel in April 2009. The first thing to mention about this hotel was the wonderful hospitality we received from Mary and Carlos. They were extremely informative, and have such fantastic personalities that it was sad to leave them at the end of our stay! They would recommend itineraries, provide information on where to eat and Carlos would be so happy to hear how our day went when we returned to the hotel in the evenings, it was so wonderful chatting to him. The other advantage of staying in this hotel is its value for money and cleanliness.The rooms have all the amenities you require, which is also why we would recommend staying here. The location of this hotel is also good for sightseeing as it located near the main train station. We were warned about staying so close to the train station but never found it to be a problem. Staying at Hotel Welrome was a highlight of our entire trip and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: tetsmum
Reviews.Content: I visited as a lone parent with two young teenage girls, and couldn't have been better supported on our first independent travel experience. I only joined the website today, but had to add my voice to all those saying 'stay here'. For the price it is unbelievable - I have paid 5 times as much and not got the service from the concierge you do from the owners of this hotel. They are supportive, friendly, determined that you get as much as possible from your trip, and unstinting in their advice and guidance - and you need that to get the very best from a trip to their wonderful city. I want to go back - my girls say it is their best holiday ever - and when we go back, we will be staying at the same place.

Reviews.Title: “A little hotel with human touch”
Reviews.Author: isabella_sabrina
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in this hotel for nine nights. The service level had been consistent throughout our stay. Arrived early in the morning, we were checked in to Navona Room without much delay. The room is clean and well equipped. We had no qualm about the bathroom too. The hotel is located a good 10 mins walks away from Stazione Termini. Accessible to all major attractions in Rome. A well stocked supermarket is just around the corner. We had a few great dinners (and reasonably priced) at the restaurant next door. Mary and Carlos are warm and resourceful. They made us felt at home. Our trip in Rome would not be fantastic without them! Thanks,Mary and Carlos!

Reviews.Title: “The very definition of hospitality”
Reviews.Author: mikeyjr
Reviews.Content: After a slightly disappointing hotel experience in Florence, we could not have imagined a better place to stay in Rome than the Welrome Hotel with Mary and Carlos. The Navona Room was large and well equipped with double glazed windows, air conditioning, a modern bathroom and a small fridge (rare in Europe, as we discovered!). Cleanliness was of the highest standard. Mary's welcome was outstanding and she ensured we structured our short visit to Rome in the best possible way. In two and a half days, we saw all the sights - Colosseum, Roman Forum, Palatine, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Vatican City and the Vatican Museums and the Museo di Borghese. We even squeezed in time for shopping on our last day! She also told us the best ways to reach all the major attractions and pointed out the location of the local supermarket - very handy! As others have said, don't worry about the location of the hotel. It's in a perfectly fine part of the area surrounding Termini station and there are constantly lots of people around. There are cafes and restaurants nearby and the Termini and Piazza della Repubblica Metro stations are short walks away. A similarly appointed hotel in the Centro Storico would no doubt cost considerably more and you wouldn't have the wonderful service offered by Mary and Carlos. As others have said, I have no idea when Carlos and Mary sleep but they were the perfect hosts. I've never seen owners take such pride in their hotel and it is reflected in the quality of the stay that they offer to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: tjohnboston
Reviews.Content: We booked the Welrome Hotel after reading the reviews on TripAdviser, because I was concerned about safety/getting around (since it was just me, a middle aged woman, and my teenage daughter). I knew that I would want someone at the hotel who would be helpful when I was trying to figure out how to get around. When I read that one recent negative review, I wondered if I would now have a bad experience, and if the other good reviews were from friends of the hotel. NO! Welrome was wonderful. Carlos and Mary were wonderful. The first night we arrived late and tired and exhausted, so I told Mary that we would go to a grocery store in the morning for breakfast. Ten minutes later she knocked on our door, and brought us yogurt, juice, bananas, and croissants for breakfast (to put in our refrigerator) because she thought we wouldn't have time in the morning. What an angel! The rooms were small but clean with everything that you would want in them. The location was perfect and not run down or scary/not safe at all. The air conditioning worked perfectly, and somehow the heavy windows kept out the loud noises from the streets at all times. We walked everywhere, or took the bus/metro from Termini. We had no trouble between using maps and asking Mary or Carlos for directions. Carlos lent me books on everything I saw, from books about the Vatican to an excellent one about Bernini, which enriched my Rome experience even further. Don't expect luxury here, but expect to be treated luxuriously. We would definitely book with them if we returned to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “2 good 2 b true!!!!1 must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: CindylooChristchurch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is unbelievable. The hospitality , cleanliness, proximity to rail station and sights, and above all the invaluable information from Mary and Carlos, for where to eat ,shop and what and how to get to the important sights. Then the travel books that were loaned ! The list just goes on... Thank you so much for a fantastic stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I will ever stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Morrigan2002
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Welrome a number of times now, with friends, with parents, and on my own. Each time has been a wonderful experience. The hotel is well-situated right near Termini, so it's an easy walk from the airport train right to the front door. It's an easy walk to all the major sites, and with Termini close by it's very quick to catch a bus to virtually anywhere in Rome. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed, and wi-fi and a mini-fridge are definite pluses which you wouldn't normally get in another Roman hotel at these prices. Mary and Carlo (owners and operators) really make the experience wonderful though. They are always available to help you out with anything you could possibly need, whether that is directions, maps, recommendations for things to do, places to go, or restaurants to eat at, or help setting up travel plans. They are incredibly kind and enthusiastic about their guests and about the wonderful city of Rome, and will go out of their way to ensure that you have the best possible stay. I could not recommend this hotel more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Like having family in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MCMLS
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine how our vacation could have gotten off to a better start than it did in Mary and Carlo's hotel and care. To say that we were made to feel at home would be an understatement. Mary and Carlo looked out for us in every way - making suggestions and answering our questions about how and what to see, how to get around, and where to eat. It truly was as if were visiting family in the city. I look forward to recommending the Welrome to all of our friends, and to returning there as our first choice the next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great hosts, Spotless well-equipt room, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: mbezzina
Reviews.Content: Mary and Carlo are the most helpful, and knowledgeable hosts that we met in Italy. If you want to know anything about the sites or history of Rome, just ask Carlo and be prepared for a fantastic education complete with a highlighted street map to help you find your way to the sites he describes to you! Four of us stayed in the Spagna Room which was very comfortable and quiet and we appreciated the conveniences of a fridge, AC and free Wi-Fi. The ensuite bathroom was spotless and the view from our huge shuttered windows of the narrow street and cafe below was very Romanesque - each night we were serenaded by street musicians that played and sang for the patrons of the cafe under our window. Finally, the location in a quiet neighborhood within walking distance of most of the sites was truly ideal. I highly recommend Welrome Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, good value, friendly, convenient & spotless!”
Reviews.Author: 2-4-the-road-ahead
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed Mary & Carlos' hospitality. Mary is a fountain of knowledge & very helpful. The rooms are spacious & clean. The location is very central & convenient. This hotel was the best value and very comfortable - only a short walk to the main railway station. We felt very welcome and would stay here anytime we were in Rome. Thanks to you both - Arrivederci a Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl30
Reviews.Content: I knew the second I spoke to Mary on the phone when I was booking my room that she was going to make our trip much easier and more effiecient. When arriving to the Welrome we were greeted by Mary and shown our room "Navona". The room was extremely clean with a spacious bed and a TV with english channels. Both Mary and Carlo were full of info and suggestions that saved us a lot of time and money during our travels in Rome and best suggestion ever was the ROMA pass. I highly recommend this hotel for people who are looking for a convenient home base in Rome, but mainly for the warmth and care of Mary and Carlo who never steered us the wrong way!

Reviews.Title: “Very hospitable and friendly place”
Reviews.Author: Broomy57
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for three nights in May prior to a cruise leaving from Rome. The proprietors were very helpful in finding places to eat and get around, always friendly, and generous with their time. The room was no frills, but clean and quiet, and just a few blocks from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Consider it a Home In Rome!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferRD_R
Reviews.Content: I was travelling on my own to Rome on business for a limited time [4 nights and 5 days], in this period I could only spare one day to see the sights. Staying at Welrome Hotel was a fantastic experience. They took care of me as if I was family! Talk about true Italian hospitality – that is what you will receive at Welrome Hotel. Mary and Carlo of Welrome, keep you well informed of the best and reasonable places to eat, visit and shop. Their tips on routes to the sights of Rome are excellent. I followed their advice and enjoyed my entire stay in Rome. The location is one among the best in Rome, located very close to the Termini station. Most of the sights are within walking distance. There are some delicious restaurants around the area. I had dinner at Giovannis and Babbos, both recommended by Carlo. Since Italian food is amongst my favorite world cuisines, being able to experience the authentic fare so close to my hotel , after a working day was truly awesome and absolutely delicious! I traversed along some of the shopping areas around the area and managed to get some good deals on clothes, bags and souvenirs. I had taken a pre-booked tour of the Vatican from Viator.com. This was well worth it, as the guide was extremely knowledgeable and well experienced in managing all types of travelers. The rest of the sights I saw taking the Hop on and Hop off bus tour. The sights of Rome are truly breathtaking. It is not called the Eternal City for nothing! I hope to come back to Rome someday with my family and friends, we will definitely stay at Welrome Hotel again. After all, who wouldn’t want to stay at a hotel which is like a Home in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, convenient for sightseeing and great hosts”
Reviews.Author: MyRoo2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Welrome Hotel for 4 nights during the second week of June/09. Mary and Carlo are such wonderful hosts with a wealth of information regarding sightseeing and navigating Rome, excellent restaurants, shopping and recommendations for many other nearby services that we needed to find. I was amazed at the patience and completeness with which they responded to our queries - no question went unanswered.They provided us with all the information we could possibly need to make our trip to Rome a truly memorable experience. The room, with a king size bed and a shower was always very clean, comfortable and quiet - much larger than we expected. Having a fridge and a safe in the room was convenient as well. I would highly recommend this quaint little hotel without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: ladyelleMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my husband for three months and we stayed here. The service is great and the constant tips we got from the owners were invaluable. They made our expereince in Rome memorable. From planning our days to where to eat, they knew it all. The rooms are very clean and the value was great. In the three months of travelling in Europe, this hotel was the best value for money and the location is great as we walked everywhere. It's also close to some fantastic pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Welrome was perfect place for our stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: bmartucci
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2009--my 18 yr old son, my 20 yr old daughter, myself and my husband. We wanted somewhere near the train station, as we were only using public transportation. We walked to the Welrome from the train station (pulling our suitcases behind us!) with no problem. The directions on the website were great. It's kind of on an alley, and you have to ring the doorbell to get in. We saw Mary most of the time and she was very helpful and friendly. Strangely enough, they were not in Rick Steves (which I used for most of our trip and was not disappolnted--we were away 11 days: 3 days in Sorrento, 6 days in Orvieto in Umbria and 2 days in Rome) but it was a great place to stay. They had a nice quad room--the Spagna--it had a foyer, a wardrobe with a safe (very handy), and nice large bathroom and a large bedroom--one king bed and 2 twins. It also had a fridge, which came in handy. The "supermercato" is down the street and we promptly bought some drinks and snacks. Mary directed us each day in the best way to accomplish what we wanted to do. You had to always ring the doorbell to get in, but someone was always there. There is a restaurant right outside the hotel and of course, many all around. We walked everywhere-except for the Vatican City. She advised us of the bus to take and where to get the tickets, so we took a local bus to the Vatican and worked our way back by walking. We saw the Coliseum, the Roman Forum, the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, the Vatican City (the only place we didn't go in), the Victor Emmanual monument, Castel Sant'Angelo, and the Pantheon in a day and a half! Then it was an easy train ride to the airport for our flight home. I also got on the internet across the street to check our flights the day before--costs 2 euros for an hour (less for less time). The hotel was spotless and we felt it was a great value and a great location, esp with Mary as your host!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant find”
Reviews.Author: GartmoreGal
Reviews.Content: Our 'booked' hotel denied all knowledge of us so luckily we looked across the road and there was the Welrome. A delightful hostess, full of knowledge and really helpful to us. The room was very large and clean and even had a fridge. We spend a fabulous few days there and would really recommend it. It was easy to walk into the centre of Rome and see all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrcs
Reviews.Content: Mary and Carlo really are welcoming and helpful.This is a quiet hotel close to most attractions in Rome.We had a wonderful stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best host, Caring & convenient”
Reviews.Author: coco755
Reviews.Content: Best host, Caring & convenient. We decide to book Welrome hotel after reading the tripadvisor’s reviews. And we glad to make a right decision. I want to thank the owners Mary and Carlo, they do everything to make you feel welcome in their hotel and in Rome. Mary will give my 7-year old daughter a chocolate/snack in the morning and introduce us the good breakfast at reasonable price. They also provide us the Rome map for free, and gave us very good advices and tips in how to see the city in every day. So, you can skip some research in visiting Rome if you stay in Welrome. The owners are excellent tourist guide. Here are the reasons I select Welrome and hope everyone can visit there to feel it. Location: convenient. 8 minutes walk to Termini Station; good connection to Florence. 10 minutes walk to Subway, 8 minutes to bus station. 3 minutes walk to the supermarket. Excellent services. It is the 5-star services. Super. Room: with refrigerator and safer. Clean and comfortable. Price: Resonable. Welrome is the best host hotel I ever stay, and I would highly recommend it to all kinds of travelers. We really appreciate Mary and Carlo’s advices and have a great time in staying there. And hope everything go well after the earthquake.

Reviews.Title: “Considerate,caring,clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: SheffieldMilly
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a few days in Rome staying at the Welrome hotel with my mum I can completely endorse all the other reviews claims about this miniature gem of a hotel. In fact in my opinion there is nothing negative to say . Carlo and Mary are the most caring and considerate hotel owners I have ever come across, they love their city and communicate their enthusiasm to their guests in a delightful way, courteous and knowledgeable without being overbearing or intrusive. The weather was bright but cold and we certainly appreciated Mary putting the heating on ready for our return. The room had all the facilities we required, the room safe, kettle and fridge were particularly appreciated. Our days were packed with the recommendations for churches, sculptures and frescoes that Carlo made. The only recommendation he made that we didn't sample was for the best icecream in Rome-too cold! But I'm sure if we are fortunate enough to return to the Welrome we will have chance to try that as well!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its name and its fantastic reputation”
Reviews.Author: traveller_fr0m_0z
Reviews.Content: Welrome was the first hotel we booked for our Italy trip, because of its excellent reviews on Tripadvisor and Lonely Planet. We had really high expectations, and it really lived up to them. I really could not think of a more appropriate name for this hotel than Welrome, as the owners Mary and Carlo do everything they possibly can to make you feel welcome in their hotel and in Rome. It felt like we were staying with family as they would wave you goodbye in the morning, and be there to greet you again when you arrived home at night. There is seriously a lifetime's worth of sights to see in Rome, so we really appreciated their recommendations of which sights/museums/churches are not to be missed, as well as their opinions on the few which are probably not worth the time. Without them we probably would have wasted a lot of time trying to figure out buses and walking routes etc, so we were really grateful that they were able to help us with this. They are two of the loveliest and most generous people you will meet in Italy (or anywhere else!). If you have a problem of any sort while you are in Rome, they will do everything they can to make sure it is fixed. We felt so well cared for. The hotel's location was ideal for us as we arrived by train. The station is close, and it's very easy to navigate to the hotel, even with massive suitcases like we had. Pretty much all the places we visited in Rome (everything except for the Trastevere district and the Vatican) we were able to walk to from the hotel. The hotel's bedrooms and ensuite bathrooms were extremely clean and comfortable. The room features include a safe, TV (italian only), and air conditioning, which was great. In a lot of hotels the air conditioning is centrally operated, but in welrome you can set the temperature that you want for your own room. We were there in winter and were never too cold in our room, and i imagine it would be well appreciated in summer too. Every room has a fridge and we found that we saved a lot of money by stocking up on food at the supermarket nearby. The hotel doesnt serve breakfast, but we went to the bar across the street called Li Rong Cafe, where you can have coffee and a crossaint at a table for 1.60 euro. I'd def recommend that place- it was a great tasting breakfast, and it was the cheapest price we came across on our entire trip. If you stay at welrome, its really worth going to the places recommended by mary and carlo. We went to a gelateria and a trattoria which they pointed out on the map for us and they were both great value, with amazing food. They were the sort of places we never would have found for ourselves, but we were so glad we went there. Mary and Carlo make Welrome such a unique hotel, and I would highly recommend it to all kinds of travellers. I think you would struggle to find a better place to stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “The best hosts in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Di_UK
Reviews.Content: I meant to write this review ages ago....however, months on I still haven't forgotten the generosity and helpfulness of our hosts Maria and Carlo at Welrome. I stayed at this hotel in May 2008 with my mum. Maria and Carlo were so friendly and helpful to both of us - providing huge amounts of useful information about Rome. They love their city and their passion for it was infectious! Coming back to the hotel in the evening was like returning home. They would always greet you with a smile on their face. On our last morning when we had to leave early for the train, Maria very kindly bought my mum and I a delicious croissant and lovely Italian coffee for breakfast! That was such a lovely touch and one you are not likely to find in many places. In sum, it was a clean hotel in a central location with amazing hosts - I would recommend Welrome to everyone staying in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute gem of a hotel in a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: doankeleh
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed in the Welrome hotel (the Pantheon room) for three nights at the end of November. Aside from the beauty of the city itself, we were extremely pleased with the facilities Welrome had to offer. We were able to walk EVERYWHERE. The friendly hosts Maria and Carlo were sources of endless information, whether it be for general tourist hotspots, how to get around, and even reasonably-priced restaurants nearby. Each morning we'd simply state where we'd like to go for the day, then they would suggest itineraries for us to pack as much into our first trip to Rome as possible! Upon leaving, Maria even hand-delivered our favourite breakfast to our door, completely of her own accord! A definite recommendation for anyone wanting a clean, quiet, and centrally-located hotel (roughly a 5 minute walk from the termini), with approachable owners who are more than happy to offer help.

Reviews.Title: “A mother's dream”
Reviews.Author: palpa
Reviews.Content: My 25 year old son and fiance were traveling with me in Southern Italy and wanted to visit Rome on their own. Since they are not seasoned travelers, I was a bit worried about them on their own in a strange place and not able to speak the language. I found the Welrome Hotel on trip advisor and it sounded as if Mary and Carlo would be perfect "loco in parentis". I was not disappointed. Mary asked that I email her when the kids were on their way. I put them on the train for Rome, emailed Mary, and continued my travels. Mary met them at the door, addressing them each by their names, got them settled, gave them directions and assisted them in their four days in the Eternal City. When my son's fiance left her jacket in a small cafe one night, Mary called the cafe, and not reaching them, called the owner of the establishment at his home to inform him that the jacket had been left! My son was able to pick it up the next day. Mary and Carlo assisted them in obtaining cabs, finding eating establishments, groceries, etc. The room was clean, not fancy, but comfortable and the price was reasonable. I would definitely recommend this to new travelers to Rome who would rather have personal attention than fancy expensive hotels. It is nicely located near the Terminii (train station) and is a short walk to great Rome sites.

Reviews.Title: “A++ hospitality at Welrome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WorldlCitizen
Reviews.Content: Mary and Carlos were extremely helpful, gracious hosts. As soon as we arrived for our brief stay (only 1.5 days) Mary immediately started helping us. She figured out the best plan for seeing the sights we were most interested in visiting, pulling out a free map and drawing a walking itinerary for us. Then she helped us with our bags and oriented us to our comfortable room. We managed to see the Colliseum -wow-, the Roman forums, Trevi Fountains (fun), the Vatican Museum & Sistine Chapel (exhausting) and a walk by the Spanish Steps (uninspiring). We managed all the mostly with walking and two short hops on the subway. On our final evening, Carlos made arrangements for us for a 3:30 am cab pick up. The room, overlooking a slightly noisy street had shutters that blocked out 90% of the street noise We slept well. We would certainly stay at this family run hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: izziet
Reviews.Content: After reading Trip Advisor reviews I chose Welrome. The hotel is less than 10 minutes walk from the Central railway station. We used the rail link from the airport into Rome and walked to the hotel. Mary de Rosa is very friendly and attentive to her guest's needs. We arrived very late at night and she escorted us to our room and then returned with some cold drinks. The room is not large, has a small fridge, and a small cupboard to hang clothes. There is also a safe to deposit passports etc. The bed is comfortable and the room extremely quiet. The window has shutters, double-glazed windows plus thick panels which shut out all outside light. We slept totally unaware of outside noise, which in Rome never stops. The bathroom is showing signs of mould, Nothing too serious though. It is probably a good 1/2 hour by foot to most of the action. However we found this walk acceptable as there were plenty of shops and cafes on the way. A word of caution - Monday is a quiet day in Rome with most of the shops closed as well as museums, art galleries etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: OoEVEoO
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, excellent service, clean rooms with air-conditioning, a short walk from the train station - fantastic, highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: fluffmilla
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from 3 nights at the Welrome. I can't think of anything to say that hasn't been said by other visitors. Excellent location 5 minutes walk from the station; clean, comfortable room, wonderfully helpful hosts, amazingly good value for the middle of Rome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: AdvisemeNZ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Welrome for 7 nights in the last week of July. Mary & Carlos were wonderful hosts, you couldn't ask for more. They made us feel very welcome and were so helpful on our arrival providing us with extremely useful orientation and local neighbourhood information. Their helpfulness continued throughout our entire stay. The hotel itself was extremely good value for money. It had everything that we required. The room was a reasonable size for European hotels and the fridge in the room was a real bonus. The airconditioning works perfectly although we preferred to sleep with the windows open and airconditioning off. We were thankful that the hotel was so close to the main rail station (probably no more than a 5 minute walk) and it was very easy to find. Rome is walkable and so the hotel is well located for all the major attractions. If you need to use the subway, then there are two subway stations very close to the hotel. You will probably want to take the subway to the Vatican City although it is possible to walk that distance too. There is a supermarket very close. We breakfast Italian style (coffee and croissant) in the cafe across the road each morning. They are very nice and incredibly hard working people who run the cafe. There is a very nice and popular bakery just one street over. It makes excellent takeaway pizza. We had read that the area close to the main station is very seedy . We didn't experience that at all. It felt very safe even late at night. Without a doubt we will return to Rome and Hotel Welrome will be our hotel of choice. Thank you very much Mary and Carlos for our wonderful stay for 7 days in Rome. It is a superb city and you are excellent hosts.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, friendly experience... Welcomed”
Reviews.Author: travellingsmurfs
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Welrome. Mary and Carlo were wonderful and very friendly and gave us lots of information to help us see the sites of Rome in the little time we had. The hotel is close to Roma Termini within walking distance. This was my second time to Rome and if I return I will be rebooking the Welrome. Mary bought us up free cappuccinos and croissants for our breakfast on the last day! Highly recommend this hotel for couples, budget travellers and families.

Reviews.Title: “the most friendly owner”
Reviews.Author: XXXX31
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with two children, but didn't want to pay for two rooms, so this was a perfect place for us. Their large "Spagna" room had a double and two twins with plenty of room for all of our suitcases. The street was quiet, and the hotel provided easy access to the train station. However, by far the nicest thing about this hotel is the owner, Mary, who goes out of her way to make sure that your stay in Rome is a happy one. Every day we left the hotel, she made sure we went armed with whatever information we needed with respect to transportation, entrance fees, tips to save money and warnings about traps for the unwary. And to top it all off, when my daughter left her stuffed dog in the covers of the bed, Mary sent us a series of very sweet e-mails about the dog's adventures in Rome, and then mailed the dog back to us in the United States free of charge! I would strongly recommend this hotel for families!

Reviews.Title: “the perfect place, great stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CorkLishy
Reviews.Content: i went to the welrome at the end of june with my boyfriend. we had reserved a different hotel to begin with but when checked tripadvisor 2 days before going to rome I was shocked at the bad reviews. I luckily found the welrome in the lonely planet book and was delighted with the great feedback. I emailed the hotel and were really lucky to have a room available for us. our flight was delayed so we arrived in rome late enough, the hotel was very easy to find, less than a 5 minute walk from the train station,after a day traveling it was great to get a friendly welcome from carlo. carlo and mary were definately the hostesses with the mostess. soooo helpful, told us the best places to go, to see, to eat. the room had everything you would need, air conditioning, towels changed dayly, double glazed windows so there was no street noise. you can walk to every main attraction. i definately recommend the welrome, it definately made rome amazing for us!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: LikeToTravel709
Reviews.Content: The highlight of the hotel is the owners. Mary and Carlos are very nice. They are perfect hosts. They helped whenever we needed anything. The hotel is just OK. The room is small. The bathroom needs work. Whenever we flushed, we heard bubbling noise for at least half hour.

Reviews.Title: “Welrome hotel made our Rome visit special”
Reviews.Author: AmericanAbr0ad
Reviews.Content: Welrome hotel - Mary and Carlos, are the perfect hosts. They made our trip very special. They are friendly and informative about whch sights to see, when to go, etc. Their hotel is in the perfect spot in Rome, right near the Train station. It is easy to find and the location is perfect to see the sights of Rome. The rooms have air conditioning and the usual amenities. We felt that our stay at Welrome was really the highlight of our trip!

Reviews.Title: “We felt welcome at the Welrome”
Reviews.Author: JARCSydney
Reviews.Content: The Welrome was our first stop in Italy and we found it to be clean, comfortable and perfectly adequate, although the room was small. We liked the balcony and the bathroom. Mary and Carlos were extremely helpful - they were like tour guides really. Their supply of maps, ideas and historical knowledge was excellent. They provided great tips for the traveller. Jan and Rod

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Roundtheworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Welrome Hotel for 4 nights during February based on Trip Advisor reviews. The hotel was OK but I feel some reviews are a little over the top -in my view anyway. The owners were very helpful and sometimes even a little too helpful. However we arrived late at night as our flight had been delayed and they very kindly stayed up to welcome us to the hotel - past midnight. We greatly appreciated this. The room was fine although dinghy and not perfectly clean and the linen was very worn and rough. The location near Termini suited us but it is a bit of a walk in to the major sights. We enjoyed the restaurants Mary recomended and were grateful to her for booking tickets for us for the Borghese Gallery. We had a wonderful time in Rome and this was a reasonable budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: TARORON
Reviews.Content: We stayed welrome in May 2008. It's thrid time to stay there. Mary and Carlo are very kind so we fell like to stay own home. They made a lot of advice for us about Roma. I visted Roma with my wife on 2006, it's first time to stay there. After that whenever we visit Rama, we stay welrome. Rooms are neat and nice. Location is close to Termini station within 5 minutes by walk, and there is quiet. 3 minutes walking takes you to Supermarket , coin laundry and internet point. We recommend this hotel to families and backpackers.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: The_Butterfields
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Welrome Hotel in May 2008. What a gem! The location is fantastic... rooms very clean... and best of all the hospitality is extremely positive. Mary will ensure that your stay in Rome is memorable and safe. Thank you to Mary for making our stay so comfortable. When we return to Rome we'll definitely stay at your hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Rome at Welrome!”
Reviews.Author: TravelTipLady
Reviews.Content: We are just back from Tunisia and Rome. After enjoying super spacious rooms in 5 star hotels in Tunisia, at first glance our "Pantheon" room at Welrome seemed small. But we had a most comfortable bed, shower that unlike the fancier hotels did not sop the floor, small fridge, four pillows and good bed lights. We were given a coffee maker, which provided a nice shot of instant coffee before heading for our cappocino and croissant across the street. As everyone comments, one couldn't imagine more gracious and helpful hosts than Mary and Carlo. We were impressed that they quickly picked up on the fact that we had been in Rome many times before, so tailored their suggestions accordingly. Specific help not already mentioned, which in addition to the low price of the hotel, saved considerable money: Where to buy a week's bus pass, and daily directions on which number of bus to take either from i termini or a stop one block from the hotel. An inexhaustable library of pamphlets with detailed suggestions about Rome that supplemented our guidebook. Phone books and help making calls! Shop names and locations for transferring photos, buying a made-to-order leather belt, etc. In sum: Book the Welrome, but as Carlo cautioned last week, book early! They already have reservations for December 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Tour guide services at the Welrome”
Reviews.Author: JeanBQ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Welrome Dec 26- Jan 4, 2008 and were really pleased by the location, advice from the hosts, and the room. As a family of 5 with 3 kids over 18, we filled the family size room to the max. The room was quiet, spotlessly clean and reasonably priced. We found the walk from Termini Station to be very convenient, even when wheeling luggage. Mary & Carlo were the best concierges/tour guides we've met! Every day we checked our plan with them before taking off, and they advised us about timing, best route to walk to see lovely churches or art along the way, and suggestions for restaurants. We walked to most locations we wanted to visit, and the Vatican was a short Metro ride. Carlo sent us to Della Palma to choose among 100 flavors of gelato- we love this place not only for the gelato, but the coffee bar, fresh pastries, large benches inside, and restrooms. We look forward to returning to the Welrome!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: lyly
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Welrome. Rooms and hotel are clean. Carlo and Mary mapped out all the sights for us to see, gave us tips on waits for museums, where to buy tickets, restaurants and also gave us Roman history which was very interesting. We felt extremely safe at this hotel and it's located a few blocks from the train/bus station which was key for us. We walked everywhere from this hotel. Wear comfortable shoes - you'll be walking a lot. Rome is absolutely beautiful....so many monuments, fountains, history....you'll see when you visit. We'll be back and will be booking with Welrome. Thank you Carlo and Mary, you made our trip to Rome memorable!!

Reviews.Title: “A home in Rome!!!”
Reviews.Author: FordoWilson
Reviews.Content: We chose Welrome because of its great reviews and excellent proximity to the Rome termini (a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel). Next time we stay at this hotel will be because of the hospitality and warmth shown to us by the owners Mary and Carlo. The hotel is situated within walking distance to the Rome termini and metro, making it very easy to both get around Rome and to the airport. The hotel itself is located in a quiet street and is exceptionally well kept and clean. The room was very clean and tidy and a good size in comparison to some of the other hotels we have stayed in. Mary and Carlo went out of their way to share their love of Rome with us and took great care in pointing out the best features of such a large and beautiful city. It is quite obvious they take a great deal of pride in both their hotel and city. Every morning or evening Mary and Carlo would provide us with a map showing us the best sights to see, or places to eat, or even just the best spots to get gelati (and they were right!). At the end of our 4 night stay (and 6 week holiday) Mary and Carlo were lovely enough to surprise us in the morning with coffee and brioche before our long flight back to Australia. We are fortunate to have stayed in such a lovely hotel run by such lovely people. Thanks Mary and Carlo. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you to Mary & Carlos!”
Reviews.Author: Samdd
Reviews.Content: Hello Mary and Carlos, > I want to thank you for all of the wonderful hospitality you offered us while we were in Rome and staying at the Welrome. You did so much to make our time in your marvelous city special and it is such a pleasure to be with people that go out of their way to make quests feel welcome. Mary, I shall never forget how nice it was of you to help me carry my luggage to the train station, that is surely beyond the call of duty. Again thank you for all of your added effort. Most definately when I return to Rome one day, I shall book with you. I look forward to that day. >Have pleasant holidays and all the best, >Carole, Mary and Dionne

Reviews.Title: “A late review, but still felt like making one to thank them.”
Reviews.Author: vandesselkoen
Reviews.Content: It was my 5th trip to Rome (2nd for the friend I took with me) and I wanted to find another hotel than the one we stayed in last time. I looked around on the internet and contacted this hotel by email. Already in the replies from the emails, they were very friendly and gave quite some information already. I booked the trip and was eager to see if all the good reviews were right. We got a very nice welcome and immediately they gave good advice suggesting a first walk around in the city untill our room came free. All this advice was very nice, but not so needed in our case as I consider myself as a seasoned Rome traveler. Still they warned us for the tourists traps and gave some good advice. Some new restaurants I didn't know, some nice gelateria's, a nearby mall etc. Also if you have questions, they won't sleep untill they helped you. Most other hotels offer trips in cooperation with agencies eg a trip to Ostia. The people of this hotel just tell you not to take the trip and explain how to do the same but way cheaper and on your own. In general their objective is very noble: they want people to enjoy Rome and have a great time without paying too much. That isn't so hard as Roma is a marvellous place (I am not being very objective here). But when I say to people to go to Rome and give them a whole bunch of do's and don'ts I have the same objective. Rome is such an amazing place and there are so many great things to do/eat and drink, but only if you are a little smart. The people of this hotel will be the perfect help for people that aren't too familiar or confident with all this. In fact if someone would ask me tips about going to Rome, I'll send them to the Welrome as I am l sure they will return with as much love for Rome as I have now. But also for more seasoned travellers I can recommend it, as they will let you know things you don't know yet and never be afraid to ask them your specific needs or interests. More specifically about the hotel. There is no breakfast, but that is actually an advantage. Instead of a bad breakfast, you will need to go outside. They will recommend a good place and there you can get a great capuccino and brioche for just €1.70 and it is very close. So much more real and you get used to that great habit so easily. Just do as the Romans do. The rooms are clean and comfortable, not too big , but honestly if you spend too much time on them (except for the obligatory rest) you are missing all the fun of a great city. The hotel is very reachable from any airport, but somewhat out of the centre, but you can always use the metro to get in the centre, if you are tired of walking. My report has been quite long and I hope without too many language mistakes. But as a conclusion I want to repeat that I would recommend this hotel to anyone, but don't all go as I want to be able to go back someday too. But don't hesitate, this a great hotel and if you have never been in Rome, please go as you are missing something. All I want is to share my passion and I hope that as many people as possible will be abe to enjoy the amazing city that is Roma! Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: 3-2-IT
Reviews.Content: This was our first international trip. The Welrome Hotel was nice and clean. Mary & Carlo are wonderful hosts. They were so helpful and interested in what we were doing. The hotel is very near the Termini Station, the city bus and metro stops. This was great for getting around Rome. They don't serve breakfast but we felt this forced us to get out and explore the city. We found the wonderful reviews of the Welrome on tripadvisor to all be true and we are happy to add our positive review to the list.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Deanne T
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews and were not disappointed. Mary and Carlo really are the sweetest people. Every time we left the hotel they made sure we had a map marked with the best gelato spot, a beautiful statue, a great shoe store, or wherever we said we wanted to go. We stayed in the Pantheon room and found it to be very comfortable with a soft bed, wardrobe with safe, silent refrigerator, window with a street view, and plenty of hot water in the shower. Sure, the room and bathroom are small, but we didn't spend much time in the room and it was very clean. The walk to Termini was easy and I thought the neighborhood was fine. The restaurant next door to the hotel was fine as was the nearby coffee spot we discovered one morning. We stayed four nights and would have stayed more. It was hard to leave our "uncle" Carlo and "aunt" Mary.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a first timer to Rome”
Reviews.Author: mikeandmil
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Welrome Hotel earlier this year - for 6 nights (and 1 more when we flew out of Rome). The hotel is less than ten minutes walk from Termini station. The room was a very good size, with a fridge (for your own provisions as opposed to a mini bar) and a decent bathroom. It was also completely spotless. Mary and Carlo are priceless. Don't be scared by Mary's photo on the website. I don't think that I've ever met two more enthusiastic hoteliers. They man reception at all hours - whether you're coming back at 2am after dinner or taking a 5am taxi to the airport. Carlo in particular has excellent English and loves Rome. He is a Roman and couldn't be more proud of the place. He was a wealth of information on sites, sculptors, fountains, restaurants, ice cream flavours, laundromats, Italian coffee........He can talk for hours - but it's all good stuff. He must have marked 50 points of interest on our map and was very proud of us when we told him which of them we had managed to visit. There is no breakfast provided but there is a supermarket 5 minutes walk away and a cafe just over the road. It was our first visit to Rome and Carlo and Mary were able to ensure that we got the most out of our stay. I think that if we had a larger budget that we would probably not stay around Termini again. Not because it felt unsafe (it didn't) but more that it was a fair walk to most major tourist sites. The main siteseeing areas were probably 30 minutes walking (which in September was quite hot and sweaty going) - and more walking once you're there. I would however have no qualms about recommending the hotel and would certainly love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: holidaymakerstirling
Reviews.Content: great location, room nice and clean, but the highlight of the hotel are the owners. could not fault them. hospitality excellent and the information provided about rome was great. would not hesitate to recommend this small hotel!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love Rome and 4.5 Welrome”
Reviews.Author: nd2ski
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. We arrived at the Welrome weary and wary (due to all the cautions re big city travel) and were greeted by Rome's best ambassador, Mary. She tirelessly spent time acquainting us with her magnificent city. With our new information we enthusiastically set off for a twilight walk to The Spanish Steps and The Trevi Fountain-magical! Our room was comfortable and quiet. Wish there was a shelf in the bathroom, if I must criticize! Location is urban but not threatening. Daytime it's busy with people and traffic. Night I'd travel with a companion-just common sense stuff. By the way, the walk to and from the Termini train station is very short and certainly safe and secure, ditto last sentences.

HotelInfo.Name: Welrome Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Calatafimi 15-19, 00185 Rome, Italy
